Susana es la segunda persona del lado izquierdo viste chompa morado.Y de la misma manera se encuentra la foto de Bryan en la parte superior derecho que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por encontrarse laborando.
texts.en:
Corazón de Jesús Group is made up of nine members who are punctual with their payments and happy to be in their eighth loan cycle.

Susana, 31, is single.  She's the president of the group, a position the group members entrusted her with.

A few months ago Susana set up a small bakery in her home with capital she put together working in her kiosk.  Susana's new project is to suitably outfit her bakery so she can make all types of bread, cakes, and tortes.

She'll invest the loan in buying flour, sugar, milk, and baking accessories.

The group's grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan.  Susana's the second person on the left; she's wearing a purple sweater.

You can find a picture of Bryan in the upper right part of the picture. He could not be present at the meeting because he was working.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es: Olga de 52 años es integrante del grupo “Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros” la cual lo conforma 07 mujeres trabajadoras y solidarias. Olga es separada con 04 hijos 01 de ellos aún dependiente. Hace varios años que Olga se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para niños y adultos. Este negocio surgió gracias a la motivación de sus hijos y a los deseos de contar con un negocio propio. Se siente feliz pues ha logrado mejorar con la calidad de vida de su familia. A  pesar de la competencia Olga ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de casacas y chompas. Su mayor deseo es de comprar su propia casa ya que por el momento vive en casa alquilada. El grupo agradecen por colaborar con su progreso. Olga se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo rojo y chaleco negro.
texts.en: Olga, 52 years old, is a member of the "Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros" ("Shalom: God With Us") group, which is composed of 7 hard-working and united women. Olga is separated with 4 children, 1 of them still dependent. For several years, Olga has sold clothing for children and adults. This business started thanks to the motivation of her children and the desire to have her own business. She is happy because she has succeeded in improving her family's quality of life. Despite the competition, Olga has fostered loyalty among her customers. She will use the loan she requested to buy coats and sweaters. Her greatest desire is to buy her own house, since at the moment she lives in a rented house. The group is thankful for the collaboration with their progress. Olga is seated; she is the first one on the right side and is wearing a red polo shirt and black vest.

loans.use: to buy coats and sweaters

loans.name: Verónica Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natura.

En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre solera de un hijo de 10 años que estudia en escuela. Lleva tres ciclos en el  Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Doña Verónica para darle lo necesario a su hijo se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y también prepara y vende bocaditos, a ella le encanta cocinar y es por eso que decidió poner en práctica lo que le gusta y prepara estos bocaditos los mismos que son deliciosos y hace bajo pedido, los mismos que tres veces a la semana entrega en grandes cantidades. En cuanto a la venta de ropa ella sale a recorrer ya que su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa. Ella espera muy pronto y con la ayuda de los créditos poder instalar un local en su casa para así vender su mercadería y sus bocaditos, ya que son 8 años en estos negocios y ya requiere de un local.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y víveres para preparar los bocaditos. 

Su sueño es tener su local.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, known as the “City of the Royal Tamarind Trees” since colonial times, the Communal Bank “Mi Mundo Natural” (My Natural World) meets every 15 days.

Sra. Verónica lives in this place.  She is 34 years old and a single mother of a 10-year-old son who is in school.  Verónica has been with her Communal Bank for three loan cycles and enjoys being a member because the interest rates are much lower than other credit institutions.

Doña Verónica provides what her son needs by selling clothing of all types.  She also prepares and sells snacks since she enjoys cooking.  For this reason, she puts into practice the activity that she enjoys.  She prepares delicious snacks to order three times a week and in large quantities.  With her clothing business, she goes door-to-door to conduct sales but she also sells out of her home.  With the help of the loans, she hopes to establish a shop in her house very soon where she can sell her merchandise and snacks.  Verónica has been in these businesses for eight years, which is why she needs a shop.  

This loan will be used to buy clothing and ingredients for preparing snacks.  Her dream is to have a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell and ingredients for preparing snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: pay for manual labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase 3 bags of yams and 2 bags of sweet potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice for resale.

loans.name: Elsi Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Elsi curso hasta el sexto grado de primaria quien junto a su conyugue se dedican a la agricultura, procrearon 2 hijos de los cuales uno tiene 12 años y está cursando el sexto grado de la primaria y el menor tiene 3 meses de edad, con ellos vive un trabajador el cual ayuda en las diferentes actividades del campo ya que él es originario de otra comunidad la cual está lejos de donde ellos viven actualmente. Doña Elsi junto a su conyugue se dedican al cultivo de café y granos básicos (maíz y frijoles) aunque en baja escala ya que solo producen para el consumo de su hogar. Los clientes son intermediarios que se dedican a comprar café en la misma comunidad y sus cultivos están aproximadamente a tres minutos de su casa de habitación y se trasladan en vehículo ya que tienen esa facilidad.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento el cual utilizara para la compra de abono, deshierba, la siembra de 4000 plantas de café y pago de mano de obra ya que esa es la mayor necesidad que tiene para que sus cultivos generen una excelente producción ya que con las ganancias ella las utilizara para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y hogar, con el tiempo comprar más tierra para cultivar y poder graduar a sus dos hijos de la universidad ya que esa es su mayor prioridad y sueño.
texts.en:
Elsi studied up to sixth grade of primary school. She and her husband work in agriculture and have 2 sons, one of whom is 12 years old and is in 6th grade of primary school while the other is 3 months old. They have a worker who lives with them, who helps in the various farming tasks and comes from another community which is a long way from where they currently live.

Elsi and her husband grow coffee, and basic grains (corn and beans) although on a small scale as they only produce these for their own consumption. Their customers are middlemen who buy coffee in their community. Their fields are approximately 3 minutes away from their home and they get there by vehicle since they have one available. 

Elsi has asked for a loan which she will use to buy fertilizer, for weed removal and for planting 4000 coffee plants and to pay for labour. This is the greatest need she has so that she can get a good yield from her crops. With the profits she will be able to improve the standard of living for her home and family. With time she hopes to buy more land to cultivate and be able to help her 2 sons to graduate from university since this is her main priority and dream.

loans.use: to buy new plants and agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 8 de diciembre está en el ciclo número  9 del programa de comité, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación en que cada una de las integrantes esta. Esta encuesta mostro que 3 de las integrantes están en un nivel bajo de ingresos.
Una integrante de este grupo es la Sra. Angelica, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo. Comenta que con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar su negocio y así ir tratando de mejorar sus ingresos  y ayudar a su familia. Es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere salir adelante e ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para podre invertirlo en la compra de cervezas, gaseosas, vinos, y demás tipos de bebidas, para poder seguir con sus ventas, ya que quiere estar bien surtida y seguir dando a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en: The "8 de diciembre" (December 8th) is on its 9th cycle with the communal bank program. They are doing the poverty elimination survey to be able to understand the situation of each member. This survey showed that three of the members have a low income level. One member of the group is Angelica, who works selling all kinds of drinks. She says that with a lot of effort, she was able to set up her business and that way try to improve her income and help her family. She is a very selfless person who wants to move forward and improve her and her family's life. She is applying for this loan to purchase beer, soft drinks, wines, and other kinds of drinks, in order to continue with her sales, since she wants to be well-stocked and continue giving her customers what they ask for.

loans.use: to buy beers, soft drinks, wine, and other kinds of drinks.

loans.name: Marcelo De Jesús

texts.es: Marcelo es padre de 3 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde que era un niño, comenzó a conocer las actividades del campo, pues nació y creció allí, sus padres le enseñaron gran parte de lo que hoy sabe y, gracias a ello, ha podido aplicar esos conocimientos para generar ingresos que le permitan sostener a su familia; pues se dedica a trabajar como jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región y adicionalmente, posee cultivos de diferentes productos, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas para ser vendidas en las diferentes plazas de la región. El cliente es un señor pujante, activo, trabajador y dedicado a su familia, quien es la principal motivación para seguir avanzando y sobrepasar todas las adversidades que se le presentan, ya sea con sus cultivos o a nivel personal, sin embargo, siempre encuentra las herramientas para seguir avanzando. Actualmente solicita el crédito, que será invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes, entre otros) con el fin de darle continuidad a su labor, cuidar y preparar los cultivos para que las próximas cosechas sean más productivas y le permitan incrementar el margen de utilidades que recibe por la venta de los alimentos. De esta forma, Marelo sueña con mantener sus cultivos, ampliarlos y hacerlos sostenibles, para que le permitan disfrutar de una estabilidad económica y un mejor bienestar al lado de las personas que ama.
texts.en: Marcelo is the father of three children and lives in free union with his partner. Since he was a child, he began to learn the work of the countryside, since he was born and grew up there. His parents taught him a great part of what he knows today, and thanks to that, he has been able to apply that knowledge to generate income that allows him to support his family. Thus he works as a day laborer on various farms in the region, and in addition, he has fields with different products, whose harvests are collected to be sold in the various markets of the region. This borrower is a vigorous, active, and hard-working man, dedicated to his family, who are his principal motivation to continue advancing and overcome all the adversities that are presented to him, whether with his crops or at a personal level. Nevertheless, he always finds the tools to continue advancing. Now he is applying for a loan, which will be invested in the purchase of agricultural supplies (compost, pesticides, and fertilizers, among other items), with the goal of giving continuity to his work, caring for and preparing his crops so that the next harvests will be more productive and will allow him to increase the profit margin that he receives from the sale of his foods. In this way, Marcelo dreams of maintaining his crops, expanding them, and making them sustainable, so that they allow him to enjoy a stable economy and a greater well-being at the side of the people he loves.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (compost, pesticides, and fertilizers, among other items)

loans.name: Virgen Poderosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen Poderosa  está en su ciclo número 5º  del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan  y se ayudan por salir adelante se dedican a sus respectivas actividades. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con deficiencias en ciertas áreas que deben mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Flora, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles, que ella misma hace y en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y lo piden mucho sus clientes. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo esta saliendo adelante. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir con la elaboración  de las comidas que vende.
texts.en:
The Virgen Poderosa group is in its fifth cycle of the committee program, in which all the members work and help one another to move forwards. They make a living in various activities. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, and it turns out that six of them are living under the poverty line, which means that they lack basic resources in certain areas, which needs to be improved.

One of the members is Flora, who makes a living selling homemade food. The business is doing very well, because her food is delicious and is in high demand by her customers. She is a very hardworking woman who, with a great deal of effort, is moving forwards. Today, she is requesting a loan to invest in buying meat, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients to continue making the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is single and has two children. After successfully graduating middle school, Elizabeth is now an established businesswoman. She sells food items, including fish, in Apowa, near Cape Coast. She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Elizabeth uses her income to provide for the entire family. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of food items, such as fish, eggs and onions, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers' preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of food items, such as fish, eggs and onions, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es casada, tiene cuatro hijos, vive en casa de sus familiares en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel secundario. Se dedida a la comercializacion de pescado  de martes a viernes Su esposo es albañil y gana muy poco
Necesita crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo, lo que le permitirá comprar más pescado y así acudir a diferentes ferias alteñas con su producto en mayor cantidad para obtener más ventas 
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Juana is married, has four children, and lives in her family's home in the city of El Alto.  She only went to school up to high school.  She works as a fish seller from Tuesday to Friday.  Her husband is a mason and earns very little.  

She needs a loan to increase her working capital so she can buy more fish and attend different fairs in El Alto with her fish. With her larger amount of fish, she can obtain more sales. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es:
Zenon es casado, su esposa vive en el campo, tiene un  hijo que le ayuda, viven en casa de familiares ubicada la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio solo hasta el nivel de primaria. Su oficio es ser hojalatero (recicla desechos metalicos como turriles) y construye objetos metalicos para usar en el hogar 
Necesita credito para comprar más turriles que le permitan fabricar objetos de uso personal como bañadores, en mayor cantidad.
El sueño de Zenon es que sus  productos se comercialicen a nivel departamental.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Zenon is married; his wife lives in the country; he has a son who helps him; they live at a relative's house in the city of El Alto.

He only has a primary education.  He is a professional tinsmith (he recycles scrap metal like barrels) and he builds metal objects to be used in the home. 

He needs this loan to buy more metal containers that allow him to make objects for personal use, such as bathtubs, in greater quantities

Zenon's dream is for his products to be sold at the department level. 

This is his first time applying for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo para comprar materia prima para su negocio de hojalatería

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 37 years old and has six children. She is married and four of her children are in school.

Crispina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Crispina has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Crispina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 49 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlie has a piña weaving business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her piña weaving.

Merlie has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Merlie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her piña weaving.

loans.name: Aracelis Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señorita. Aracelis se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Las Triunfadoras, le gusta esta forma de crédito ya que todas sus compañeras le ayudan con su apoyo moral a salir en adelante. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se resplandece por la belleza arquitectónica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, se encuentra  bañada por 4 ríos, goza de una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

La Señorita. Aracelis tiene 24 años de edad Y es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres y comparten los gastos del hogar. 

Doña Aracelis tiene un bazar y bisutería desde hace 4 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, este trabajo le gusta mucho porque le da independencia económica y es su propio jefe.

El dinero de su crédito va a ser invertido en la compra de bisutería para crecer en su negocio. 

Su meta es ser una profesional en el área de contabilidad.
texts.en:
Aracelis is doing her second loan together with her friends and fellow members of the loan group Las Triunfadoras. She likes this type of loan, as all the other women in the group give her moral support to help her get ahead. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which shines with architectural beauty and has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since December 1999. It is bathed by four rivers and enjoys great variety in its gastronomy.

Aracelis is 24 years old and single. She lives in her parents' house and they share the household expenses.

Aracelis has had a variety and accessories store for four years now. She works from Sunday to Sunday, without a fixed schedule. She likes her job very much because it gives her financial independence and because she is her own boss.

The money from the loan will be invested in buying accessories to grow her business.

Her goal is to be an accounting professional.

loans.use: to buy accessories

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
38-year-old Janet is from Liberia. She lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known.  She is married, and her husband is a driver. They both have five children between the ages of 19 and 10.  Only three are presently in school, and live at home. She stopped her education at grade 11. 

For the past five years, she has been running a shop where she sells soap, toothpaste, milk, etc.  She started this business by selling on a market table, and later received money from her husband to increase her inventory. She learned this way of selling from her friends.  She is very happy with her business because she makes more profit every day, and it keeps her busy.  Most interestingly, she has learned the different kinds of local languages. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, toothpaste, milk, etc. for her business.  Her plan is to educate her children. She appreciates BRAC Liberia and the lenders who support them.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, toothpaste, milk, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is a 36-year-old married woman who lives in Vanadzor city with her two school-aged children. Her husband is working abroad in the Russian Federation. Armine works as a hairdresser in a small beauty salon which she rents. Her salon provides hairdressing services for both women and men. She has been working in this profession for five years and has become a very skilled hairdresser. Her salon gets many visitors since she works quickly, cheaply and effectively.
Armine has requested a loan of 300,00 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a special machine for hair washing and also some furniture for her salon as she wants to renew the interior.

loans.use: to buy a special machine for hair washing and some furniture for her salon as she wants to renew the interior

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es una joven de 24 años de edad madre de 3 hijos agricultora y ama de casa una madre de familia con ganas de superarse y de salir adelante. En compañía de su compañero de hogar se dedican al cultivo y siembra de café y hortalizas las cuales venden en la misma zona, con los vecinos, amigos y personas que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto con calidad para re vender. Natalia tiene 3 años de educación primaria cursados ya que por falta de apoyo financiero por parte de sus padres no pudo continuar, posteriormente se acompañó del que hoy en día es su pareja. Ella aprendió de sus padres el trabajo de la tierra ya que ellos son agricultores por tradición siendo esta la única actividad como medio de ingresos para su familia. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es poder aumentar sus cultivos para lograr mayores ganancias para el beneficio de su familia ya que su mayor deseo y anhelo es lograr que sus hijos puedan estudiar a nivel superior, convirtiéndose en personas con conocimiento, abriendo puertas y enfrentando los problemas económicos de manera positiva.

Es por ello que duramente en compañía de su pareja trabajan diariamente para poder cumplir sus metas y sus propósitos siendo hoy en día una de ellas el financiamiento que ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 8 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 10 QQ de fórmula 18-46-00, 10 kilos de evicet, 10 kilos de nutrí café y otra parte para será destinada para preparar la tierra y cultivar nueva semilla.
texts.en:
Natalia is a young woman of 24 years, the mother of 3 children, a farmer and homemaker, a working mother with a desire to improve and get ahead. She and her live-in partner make their living planting and growing coffee and vegetables, which they sell in the area to neighbors, friends, and people who go to the area looking for a quality product to resell. Natalia has 3 years of primary education; since she lacked financial support from her parents, she was unable to continue. Later on she met the man who is now her partner. 
She learned how to work the land from her parents; they are farmers by tradition, this being the only means of income for their family. One of her biggest challenges is to be able to increase her crops to make more profits to benefit her family, since her greatest wish and desire is to make it possible for her children to study at the level of higher education and become knowledgeable people, opening doors and facing economic problems in a positive way.
It is because of this that she and her partner work hard every day to accomplish their goals and objectives. One of these objectives is the loan that she has requested from the COMIXMUL cooperative to buy 800 lbs of 12-24-12 fertilizer, 1000 lbs of 18-46-00 fertilizer, 10 kg of evicet, and 10 kg of nutrí café. She will use the rest of the loan to prepare the land and sow new seeds.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to tend her coffee crops.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número dos del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas y cada una de ellas está trabajando arduamente, ya que quieren ir creciendo y mejorando sus vidas.
Una mujer muy trabajadora es Maria, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida, en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Comenta que con mucho esfuerzo ha ido montando y equipando su despensa, y hoy ya tiene un buen negocio. Es una persona que tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo y mejorando.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, ya que quiere seguir ofreciendo una buena calidad de productos a sus clientes. Ella quiere poder comprar comestibles, bebidas, gaseosas, verduras y demás.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Emprendedoras" group is in their second cycle with the Woman's Committee program, in which each and every one of the women are working hard as they want to grow and improve their lives. Maria is one of these hard-working women. She has a well-stocked store where she works every day from a very early hour. She comments that with a lot of effort she has built and equipped her store so that today it is a good business. She is a person who has a lot of desire to continue growing and improving.

Maria is requesting this loan to invest it in buying supplies for her store, as she wants to offer a good variety of products to her customers. She wants to buy food products, drinks, soft-drinks, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: to buy food products, drinks, soft-drinks, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 35 years old and lives in Logan Town, Liberia. From 2001 she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in her community, where she sells delicious Liberian dishes. She started this business with the small amount that she earned when she worked as a care taker, after she dropped out of 6th grade.  

She is a widow and has five children between the ages of 8 and 20 who live at home and attend school. She hopes to buy a house for her children through her business and continue to support them in school.

Comfort is requesting a loan to buy more rice, fish, charcoal, pepper, oil and others items for her business. She opens from Monday to Saturday, working ten hours each day. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, fish, charcoal, pepper, oil and other items for her business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 64 years old and married with five children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as snack foods, soft-drinks, biscuits, laundry soap, etc., to sell in her general store.

Editha has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Editha aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store.  Items she sells include snack foods, soft-drinks, biscuits, laundry soap, etc.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is single and lives at his own house where he does not have electricity but does have piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one and a half years, he has operated a motorcycle business. He faces the major challenges of motorcycle breakdowns and muddy roads during the rainy season. He dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing himself.

With the loan of 50,0000 KES, he wants to purchase spare parts for his motorbike. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and four of her children are in school.

Erna has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional food products to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Erna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional food products to sell.

loans.name: Gazmir

texts.en:
Gazmir is a 28-year-old single man from southeastern Albania. He holds an undergraduate degree, yet he has decided to run his own activity in agriculture

During his interview, Gazmir says, “Even though I went to university, I knew what I wanted to do besides education. Being raised in a village, I had enjoyed all the goods up to that moment, so continuing on the same route as my parents and like so many other people with a farming upbringing, would be a joy for me; and so far, no regrets. For four years now, I have been selling raw milk and other agricultural produce and I plan on continuing the same activity.”

Gazmir wants to stock up on animals’ fodder for the winter with the loan he is requesting.

loans.use: to stock up on animals' fodder for the winter season.

loans.name: Estilita

texts.en:
Estilita is 62 years old and married with 12 children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines.

Estilita is borrowing 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional livestock and vitamins for her business. She has been raising livestock for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Demitilah

texts.en:
Demitilah is a mother of three children who go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Demitilah prepares various foods, such as flat bread, beans, and rice, and sells them to her customers. She owns a kiosk that sells various items such as cigarettes and groundnuts, which she sells from her home to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, and packets of cigarettes. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, and packets of cigarettes.

loans.name: Fenny

texts.en:
Fenny is a 32-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Fenny has a Nito basket weaving business in the Philippines. Fenny requested a loan of PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her Nito basket weaving.

Fenny has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Fenny would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her Nito basket weaving business.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in the Kutaisi district, West Georgia with her 13-year-old daughter, who goes to school, and her 81-year-old grandmother, who is provided with a retirement pension. 

Tamar has opened a clothes shop locally. However, as the income is not enough for the family, Tamar decided to open a bakery. She sought credit among local financial institutions but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. 

The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting a business. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of US$2000.

With the received credit she will open a bakery and bake Georgian bread. This will increase the income of her family and she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to open a bakery

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 26 years old and lives in Vanadzor city. She has a higher education with a specialty in pedagogy, but she has never worked in this field. Ruzanna is married and she has a small son.

For the past three years, Ruzanna has worked in clothing trading in her own shop. She sells both women and men's clothing which she buys from Yerevan wholesale markets. She has two saleswomen who work at her shop and help her. Her husband also works; he is a policeman with the Military Police. 

Ruzanna has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy a new autumn-winter men and women's clothing collection to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy a new autumn-winter men and women's clothing collection to sell in her shop

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Benedicta es una mujer de 33 años, está casada con Julio y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Inicialmente se dedicaba a las actividades agrícolas en unas parcelas que posee afueras de la ciudad hasta que logró reunir dinero suficiente y con la intención de permanecer al lado de sus hijos puso una tienda de comestibles en el primer piso de su vivienda. Cada mañana se levanta muy temprano y recibe a sus clientes a quienes trata con mucho cariño por ser el eje principal de su negocio y les ofrece una diversa variedad de productos tales como cereales, verduras y alimentos enlatados como leche, conservas; entre otros.
Le gusta mantener su negocio siempre bien abastecido ya que es la clave para mantener a su clientela. Lleva 12 años con su tienda y eso también le sirvió para ganar buenas amistades y ser una vecina muy conocida. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de arroz, cereales y conservas enlatadas.
texts.en:
Benedicta is a 33-year-old woman. She is married to Julio and has 4 children, and she lives with them in her own house. At first, she worked in agriculture, on some plots of land she owns outside the city, until she was able to save up enough money. Then, with the aim of remaining close to her children, she set up a grocery store in the first floor of her home. Each morning, she gets up very early and serves her customers, whom she treats with great warmth, since they are the heart of her business, and she offers them a broad variety of products, such as grains, vegetables and packaged foods such as milk, canned goods, and other items. 

She likes to keep her business well-stocked at all times, since that is the key to retaining her customers. She has 12 years of experience with her store, and this has also allowed her to make good friendships and become very well-known in the neighborhood. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support she is receiving in order to get ahead. She is also committed to making her payments on time. On this occasion, she would like to have 2,000 Peruvian new soles to buy rice, grains and canned foods.

loans.use: to buy rice, grains and canned goods.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
This nice lady Karine lives in the city of Kapan with her husband, son, and daughter. She is 54 years old. After school she studied at the medical college, and after graduating for many years she worked here as a lecturer. Now Karine is engaged in the medication trading business and she works at her own pharmacy as a saleswoman. She also sells baby food and various hygiene supplies. She mentions that there are very few pharmacies in their city and this business is more or less profitable for her family.

Karine asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to buy some new medicines that she doesn't have in her pharmacy and that are of great demand among her customers.

loans.use: in order to buy some new medicines that she doesn't have in her pharmacy and that are of great demand among her customers

loans.name: Dritan

texts.en:
Dritan is a 37-year-old married father of a very young child. Many times in the past, he went to Greece for work. 

“I enjoyed working in Greece, and I am sorry that the country is now experiencing financial difficulties.  Albanians were very to have been given the opportunity to immigrate and work in Greece, because not only we secured an income by working there, but also we managed to send money over to our families and invest in Albania. Anyhow, I wish they solve their financial condition soon”. 

Dritan has been selling used items to the market and now he wants to buy some more fall and winter items to resell.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma appreciates Kiva for the loan he received that improved his living standards. He is requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase a new motorcycle. He joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 47 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Helen has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Dorithy

texts.en: Here is Dorithy: she is 47 years old and lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well known. She is a widow and has six children aged between 19 and 30--only two are presently in school and live at home. She is a second grade dropout. For the past 30 years she has been running a table where she sells fish and charcoal. She started this business with a little money she saved and learned this way of selling from her friends. She likes her business because she makes lot of profits and it keeps her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish and charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Gullanpugro  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Gullahnpugro está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en el cantón de Nabón,  este lugar es de clima frió, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza y sus tierras son muy fértiles, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno. Su gente al igual que las socias mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, su principal fuente de ingreso es la agricultura, crianza de animales y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades que les ayudan a mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares, todas tienen un objetivo en común el cual es la superación familiar.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Digna, se encuentra realizando su tercer crédito en el grupo de crédito Gullanpugro, le gusta esta forma de créditos por la unión y compañerismo que existe entre todas las socias, al mismo tiempo que los créditos le ayudan a mejorar su negocio.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Digna, tiene  31 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 12, 9, 7 y 2 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la dura tarea de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Digna se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y lo que cosecha lo vende en la ciudad, también cría borregos, cuyes, cerdos, gallinas y ganado. 

El dinero de su cerdito lo va a  invertir en la compra de abono, semillas y alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es  criar mas cuyes y de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
The Gullahnpugro loan group is made up of 6 female members and 1 male member, who live in the Nabón canton. This area has a cold climate, with very fertile land and has several areas of natural beauty. Its architecture is a mix of colonial and modern. Its people, like the team members, maintain their culture and traditions. Their main source of income is from agriculture, animal husbandry, and many leave the city daily in order to work in different activities that will help improve their economic stability at home. All have a common goal, which is to improve their family lives. 

One of the female members of this group is Digna, who is applying for her third loan for the Gullanpugro loan group. She likes this way of getting loans because of the unity and camaraderie that exists between all of the members. At the same time these loans help her to better their business. 

Digna is 31 years old, married and has had four children who are now aged 12, 9, 7 and 2. The first three children are studying in a small school in the city. Her hardworking husband works in construction as a bricklayer. The house in which they live is their own. 

Digna works in animal husbandry and agriculture and planting vegetables. That which she harvests she sells in the city. Furthermore, she raises sheep, guinea pigs, chicken and cattle. 

The money from this loan will be invested in purchasing fertilizer, seed and feed for their animals. 

Their goal is to raise more guinea pigs of better quality.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and animal feed

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is 30 years old and married with 2 children who are 4 and 8 years old, respectively. He runs a phone accessories business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. One of his children is going to school and he has one additional dependent at home.

He has been in this business since 2001 and sells a variety of phone accessories within a busy market area. He says that the main challenge to his business is insufficient capital for expansion.

Osman requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase a variety of phone accessories for his shop and calling centre. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him repay his loan and increase his business. In the future, he would like to expand his business more. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of phone accessories for his shop and calling centre.

loans.name: Giberilla

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Giberilla from Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. He is married with two children between the ages of two and seven years. He began this business because he wants to create a permanent source of income to take care of his family.

Giberilla runs a general stock business. He sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and soap. He has been running this business after the rebel war. He works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. He says that the main challenge to his business is the high rate of thieves within the community.

Giberilla has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, pure water, and mayonnaise. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his children's school fees and buy a plot of land. In the future, he plans to become an agent of provision and cigarette seller. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, pure water, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 41 years old and lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is unmarried and has four children between the ages of 23 and 9 who are presently in school and live at home. She stopped her education at 10th grade. For the past six years she has been running a store where she sells charcoal. She started this business with a little money from her susu (daily local saving) and managed to establish this business. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She likes her business because she makes lot of profits and it keeps her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 61 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lucy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, noodles, sugar, detergent, soap, eggs, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, sugar, detergent, soap, eggs, and other groceries. 

Lucy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, noodles, sugar, detergent, soap, eggs, and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Sheila appreciate the previous loan she took from Kiva. She has requested for a loan of KES 100,000 to purchase a new sewing machine and start a motorcycle business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and start a motorcycle business

loans.name: Nelufar

texts.ru: Нелуфар трудолюбивая и очень активная девушка в возрасте 28 лет. Она замужем и имеет одного ребёнка. Живёт вместе со своей семьёй в маленькой деревушке. Она очень любит свою семью, своего мужа и маленькую прекрасную доченьку. Дочка Нелуфар ещё маленькая и ходит в детский сад. Чтобы зарабатывать как-то на жизнь Нелуфар подрабатывает в местной больнице санитаркой. Муж Нелуфар уехал на заработки в Россию. Там он работает строителем. Ежемесячно он присылает в семью деньги. Она очень благодарна своему мужу за старание сделать их жизнь лучше. Нелуфар имеет мечту, жить в хорошо устроенном доме, где она может растить свою прекрасную дочку в хороших условиях. Сейчас дом, в котором они живут нуждается в капитальном ремонте, так как он был построен совсем давно и сейчас уже имеет много недостатков. Но заработанных Нелуфар денег не хватает на подобные расходы. Только приходится откладывать на ремонт дома из заработка мужа. Нелуфар некоторое время назад уже начала ремонт в своём доме. Но вскоре пришлось остановить работу, так как накопленных денег не хватило. И сейчас Нелуфар желает продолжить ремонт дома и наконец завершить. По этой причине она решила взять кредит. Нелуфар обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит для покупки строительных материалов на ремонт дома. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nelufar is a hardworking and very active young woman of 28. She is married with one child and lives with her family in a small village. She loves her family very much, her husband and her wonderful little daughter, who is still small and goes to kindergarten. In order to earn a living, Nelufar works as a cleaner in the local hospital. Her husband has gone away to work as a construction worker in Russia and sends the family money every month. She is very grateful to her husband for trying to make their life better. 

Nelufar has a dream of living in a well-built home where she can raise her wonderful daughter in good conditions. The house they live in now needs major repairs since it was built a long time ago and has many problems. But Nelufar's wages won't cover the costs, so she has to put aside money for the renovations from her husband's earnings. Some time ago, Nelufar began fixing up her house. But she soon had to stop working due to lack of funds. She now would like to continue the repairs and finally finish them. For this reason she has decided to ask for a loan. Nelufar has turned to Arvand for a loan to purchase building materials for renovations to her house. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials to fix up her home

loans.name: Olgerta

texts.en:
Olgerta, who is being photographed here with one of her children, is a 29-year-old married mother of two very young children living in a city, and is an Egyptian Albanian. 
Olgerta is requesting lenders help and generosity for the first time because she needs to take care of some medical expenses. 

The money that her and her husband generate is never enough for them to be able to put some away for the rainy days. The amount she needs is 50,000 Albanian Lek.
“We are responsible people and we will pay back the loan no matter what. This is a promise,” said Olgerta.

loans.use: to cover her medical expenses.

loans.name: Osman      B

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Osman from Waterloo Western Rural Area in Freetown. He is married with one child who is two years old. In 2009, Osman established his phone accessories business. He began this business because he wants to create his own permanent source of income. Before that, he was a shopkeeper. 

He works in the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge is lack of enough capital to run his business.

Osman requires a loan in order to buy phone chargers, extensions and a variety of phone accessories for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and renovate his house. 

In the future, Osman plans to import his goods from a neighboring country. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy phone chargers, extensions and a variety of phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mohamed from Waterloo in the western rural area in Freetown. He is married with two children age 12 and 17 years. In 2008, Mohamed established his clothing business. He began his business because after he completed his sixth form his family could not afford to pay his college fees, so he raised money to start up his business. Before this he was a cleaner. He works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is the lack of enough capital to run his business.

Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy men's shirts, shoes, jeans, and ladies' jeans to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and repay his loan. In the future Mohamed plans to build his own business structure and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy men's shirts, shoes, jeans, and ladies' jeans to expand his business.

loans.name: Evarline's Group

texts.en:
Evarline's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Evarline is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past two years, Evarline has been working hard to manage her drug shop, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Evarline has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drips and tablets for the pharmacy and will help Evarline to generate greater profits and to open up another branch in the next trading center. Evarline hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch. 

Evarline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more drips and tablets for the pharmacy.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's Group is comprised of two, hardworking women. Sarah is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro, in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past five years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells groceries, such as sugar, rice, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a fridge and sugar. This will help Sarah to generate greater profits, by incresing her sales. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and sugar for her store

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is an old client, having borrowed three times from UGAFODE Micro finance. She has a restaurant in Ishaka town along a busy Street which serves an average of 40 people per day. She gives the business an average of 10 hours per day and she has done this since 2003. In addition to the restaurant business, she is also involved in agriculture (growing bananas) which greatly boosts her monthly income. She started the business so she could support her family financially. She hopes to use the Ugafode loan (ugx.1,200,000) to buy more food stuffs to use in her business. Her future hope is to pay school fees for all her children so that they can have a decent education. Agatha says her main challenge is the irregular income of the people in the community she serves.

loans.use: To buy food for the restaurant

loans.name: Rwakirungura People's Association Group

texts.en:
Jolly, a member of the Rwakirungura People's Association lives in rural Kirungura – Rukungiri western Uganda. She is a widow aged 52 years. She has four children who are all older than 18 years of age, including one who is studying.

She has been growing and trading vegetables and sometimes deals in produce trade in corn and coffee on a seasonal basis. With this loan she will increase her working capital and buy many seeds to grow vegetables to earn more. In coming years she wants to see all of her children continue with school. She thanks Kiva lenders for being interested in the group's enterprises and pledges to maintain the partnership.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Guderia

texts.en:
Guderia is a 56-year-old, hard-working woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells fresh foods but is also actively involved in growing bananas and maize in order to support her family.

Like most people in this sector, Guderia is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and poor storage facilities. Her dream is to own a food store that can supply the region. Guderia intends to use the loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a hard working woman with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a bakery, sells porridge and trades in agricultural produce in order to earn a living. Being the good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to university, even though she did not go to school herself. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are her major challenges, while her dream is to buy land and construct a house for residence. Enid is requesting a loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with five children. He is forty years old and he lives in the outskirts of Kyotera with his family. His children are fifteen, twelve, eight, six and three years old respectively. Four of his children are attending school. He also takes care of two other children whom he is helping with tuition payments.

John is a farmer who deals in agriculture, specifically matooke, coffee and passion fruit growing. He supplements his income with renting his motorcycle on daily basis. 

He works six days a week, and each day he works for eight hours. He has been in this business since 1988. He concentrated on agriculture because he has experience in farming and this was an advantage since it was easy for him.

He has acquired this loan in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his passion fruit garden. He sells his agricultural products to traders around his area. His dream is to be the leading supplier of these products in the area.

John faces the challenges of too much drought and diseases that attack coffee. He describes himself as honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his passion fruit garden.

loans.name: José De La Cruz

texts.es: Don Jose tiene 63 años de edad, soltero, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara junto a sus tres hijos. Don Jose realiza su propia actividad de negocio para generar ingresos. Anteriormente trabajaba en transporte con un bus escolar y hace mas de tres años decidió dedicarse a la comercialización  de agua purificada  en botellón y en bolsa. Las ventas son a domicilio, compra y distribuye el producto a personas particulares y pulperías, el utiliza una motocicleta para la distribución. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo que es por 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar agua en botellones y en bolsa para incrementar su inventario y aumentar las ventas. Sigue con la meta de llegar a formar una microempresa distribuidora de agua para generar ingresos para su familia. Agradece mucho el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Jose is 63 years old, single and lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara together with his three children. Don Jose generates his income from his own business. Previously he worked in transportation with a school bus. More than three years ago he decided to devote himself to selling purified water in large bottles and bags. He sells door-to-door. He buys and distributes the products to individuals and stores using a motorcycle for delivery. He has requested a second loan for 10,000 Lempiras, with which he will buy water in bottles and bags to increase his stock and increase sales. His goal is to eventually form a small business in water distribution in order to generate income for his family. He is very grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: Compra de botellones y bolsas de agua para vender.

loans.name: Kireku Development Group

texts.en: Naume is a hardworking 27-year-old woman with two children. She is a member of Kireku Development Group and is married to Abius and together they run a small shop in the rural Kireku village in Wakiso district. Her dream is to change her small shop to a wholesale shop though this has been limited by income that is divided between fees and buying stock. She wants the loan to buy retail stock items in order to increase her profits. She thanks fellow group members for being cooperative and innovative.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is thirty-five years old and has five children. He lives in a rural setting with his family. His children are fourteen, twelve, ten, eight, and six years old, respectively.

Steven is a businessman who has a retail shop in his village. He works seven days a week, and each day he works for twelve hours. He supplements his shop income with seasonal produce trading.

Steven has had his business for ten years and started it with the aim of increasing the family income. He sells his goods to residents in his rural area. He has acquired this loan in order to buy house hold use items for sell in the retail shop. He also hopes to build rentals in his trading center and set up other outlets in different villages in the area in the near future. However, he still faces a challenge of a delay of payments by his customers since the majority take goods on credit.

Steven describes himself as a hardworking and honest man. He asks lenders, in particular Ugafode, to continue with their work of helping poor people with their development efforts.

loans.use: to buy house hold use items for sell in the retail shop

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a new client at the branch. He is 30 years old and very hardworking. He has two children, whom he hopes to give the best education using the money he earns from his carpentry business. Carpentry is his sole source of income. He started the business in the year 2000 and conducts it in Cell C, Ward 4; his clients are mainly the local people of the area. He hopes to use the loan (five hundred thousand Ugandan shillings--500,000 UGX) to buy timber, which he will use to make items for sale. His major challenge is the price fluctuation of timber, but he hopes to overcome this if he gets the UGAFODE loan.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Norma Lilian

texts.es:
Doña Norma es una mujer de 41 años de edad acompañada y de su relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales están estudiando en diferentes grados de educación secundaria. Ella tiene un nivel de educación primaria completa la cual con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio por parte de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron a muy temprana edad la actividad del cultivo pudo completar. En el área de trabajo se involucra nada más la familia ya que juntos diariamente en compañía de sus hijos al terminar la jornada de estudio se desplazan hasta el campo en donde realizan todas las actividades para mantener sus siembras protegidos los cuales están ubicados a 1 kilómetro de distancia de su casa de habitación. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en el mercado local en pequeña escala y con algunos compradores que vienen de otras regiones cercanas al lugar donde ella habita.

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales, hombres y mujeres de bien desempeñándose en un mundo de la mejor manera posible y con el tiempo, por medio de las tierras que hoy en día trabajan generar empleo a otras personas por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 5 QQ de fertilizantes, 5 QQ de urea, 5 QQ de formula cafetalera y 5 litros de nutro café con los que dará mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café para empezar a llevar a cabo sus planes y sueños.
texts.en:
Norma is a 41-year-old woman. She and her partner have five children, who are in different grades in secondary school. She completed her primary education, thanks to a lot of effort and sacrifice on the part of her parents, who also taught her how to farm. On the farm it is only the family that works, with no external help. The family heads to the countryside every day, along with the children once they have finished their school day. That is where they do the work necessary to maintain their protected crops. Their crops are one kilometre away from their home. 

Norma's harvest is sold in the local market on a small scale, and to certain buyers who come from different regions near to the place where she lives. 

She dreams of seeing her children grow up to be professionals and good people, getting by in the world in the best way possible. With time, by way of the land that they are currently working, Norma hopes to create employment opportunities for other people. It is for this reason that she is currently asking for a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative, in order to buy five quintals of fertilizers, five quintals of urea, five quintals of coffee fertilizer and five litres of coffee nutrients. With these items, she will maintain her crops and help them to grow, so that she can begin to carry out her plans and dreams.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for growing her coffee crops.

loans.name: Al Anoud

texts.en: Al Anoud is 21 years old. She lives with her mother and two siblings, as her father is deceased. She is studying in her fourth year for her Bachelor of Medical Analysis degree. She is now one step closer to graduation. Her aim is to work in her field after graduation to help cover her family's needs. Her family is not able to pay for her study fees as they are currently facing a financial crisis. For that reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her study fees

loans.name: Fathiya

texts.en: Fathiya is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. She also has a brother who is a teacher and another one who is a bus driver. One of Fathiya's sons is currently studying a Bachelor of Electrical Engineering (3rd year). He is planning to work in his study field in the future to be able to help his family financially. As Fathiya is currently facing financial problems, she is not able to cover her son's study fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s semester fees

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal  tiene 41 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia. Anibal es agricultor desde hace algunos años y le gusta mucho lo que hace, también para tener un dinero extra para su hogar trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, anibal cree que está saliendo adelante porque trabaja muy duro y porque tiene mucha fe en que su vida mejorara.

Anibal agradece a los prestamistas kiva por su gran apoyo ya que gracias a su ayuda el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, ya que mejorar el techo y las paredes que se encuentran en mal estado, así podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Anibal is 41 years old and lives in the city of Aguaytia.  He has been a farmer for several years and really enjoys what he does.  In addition, to make some extra income he works as a motor-taxi driver, Anibal thinks that he is getting ahead because he works really hard and has faith that his life will get better.

Anibal is thankful to the lenders of kiva for their great support because thanks to their help he will be able to make improvements to his residence, such as fixing the roof and the walls that are in bad shape, this way he can continue fighting to make his big dream a reality: "to build a home made of quality materials"

loans.use: to make improvements to residence.

loans.name: Hassan Group

texts.en:
This group is called “Hassan”. It is made up of four members who work together in different areas. This is a group of women with initiative, values and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays. They requested a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB. 

Dhakra is 26 years old. She is the leader of this group and lives in Aden, Yemen. She is a door-to-door merchant; specifically she sells new clothes for women. She buys her merchandise from distributors and stores where the prices are cheaper. She began this activity due to the lack of a clothes market in her neighborhood. Dhakra is very grateful to her neighbors who supported her over all these years. At the present time, her business doesn't make much profit due to the bad situation in Yemen. As such, she applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc. She will sell them to her customers, giving her the opportunity to increase her income from the business.

loans.use: to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Basema

texts.en: Basema is a housewife who was born in 1963. She is married and has three sons. Her husband works fixing cars which is a weak source of income, and her sons work at a cafe. They all live in a rented house. One of Basema's sons is working at the cafe and studying at the same time for a Diploma in Airports and Travel and Tourism Office Management (2nd year). He is planning to start studying a Masters of Audio Engineering after he gets his Bachelor degree. As Basema is currently facing financial problems, she is asking for a loan to pay for her son's study fees. Because Basema is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for her son's study fees

loans.name: Sadiqa

texts.en:
Sadiqa is the age of 48, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is an old member of BRAC and she is taking another loan after her two previous loans. Two years ago, she took a loan and purchased an auto rickshaw for her husband with contributions from her savings. Due to continuously driving and due to bad condition of roads the rickshaw body got gradually depreciated. During driving it creates a rattled noisy voice, which is ridiculous for the passengers. His daily income is spent on household expenses and he does not have savings to fix the problem.

Therefore, Sadiqa contacted with the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and let us know about her financially condition. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. Due to her excellent repayment schedule the field officer approved a loan for her. 
With this amount her husband would be able to repair rickshaw body and able to drive it again.
Sadiqa seems very happy after taking this loan and says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair an auto rickshaw body.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a 50-year-old a farmer. She is married to Antony and together they are blessed with four children, only one of whom fully depends on them. Anastasia has been practicing mixed crop farming her for the past eight years with a monthly income of KSH 8,000, which she uses to provide for her family. she also practices dairy farming to supplement her income.

Anastasia is applying for her second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully and comfortably.  

Anastasia will use the loan to buy dairy feeds, seedlings and fertilizer. With the expected profit from the business, she will improve the living standards of her family and pay school fees for her child. 

Her hopes and dreams are to become a wholesale distributor of cereals.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds, seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pablo Gilter

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre de 53 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus 6 hijos, el es muy trabajador y dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacara adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Pablo pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación.
Por iniciativa propia, Pablo trabaja como profesor de lengua y literatura en un colegio, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Pablo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de transporte ya que por motivos de trabajo debe trasladarse a un poblado de su ciudad para seguir dictando sus clases, así pues Pablo seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Pablo, 53, lives in the city of Pucallpa with his six children.  He's very hardworking and puts all his effort into getting his family ahead.  Thanks to his effort, Pablo was able to study for a career in education.

On his own initiative, Pablo teaches language and literature in a school.  He works approximately 10 hours every day.  He believes it's going well for him because of his dedication and the friendly way he treats others.

Pablo's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll cover his transportation expenses.  He has to travel from his city to a town to teach his classes.

This way Pablo will keep on working and making the effort to achieve his big dream of seeing his children become good professionals.

loans.use: to cover transportation expenses

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel A. (left), owner of Jessica's boutique, works with her sister Angelica (center) and their mother Raquel R. (right), who all live in the same home under the financial support of Raquel R.’s husband. To help him, they decided to go into business together. Raquel A., with 12 years of retail experience, decided to open her own business and partner with the other two.

Serving Jessica’s boutique, a women’s clothing and accessories store in El Paso, Texas, the three ladies knew with the growth of their business, they needed to obtain working capital. 

When Raquel A. ventured to community partner, Project Vida, where she regularly attends monthly business seminars, she was referred to nonprofit microlender Accion Texas Inc. 

The loan will provide the women with funds to purchase accessories and clothes for the almost-two-year-old business, located in a busy part of town.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: La cliente reside en el sector de Suburbio en Guayaquil.  Empezó años atrás vendiendo ropa a crédito y luego línea de cosméticos.  Actualmente también emprende en la comercialización de productos naturales de Herbalife.  La mayoría del tiempo trabaja sola y a veces le ayuda a su hijo mayor a cobrar.  Realiza esta actividad desde su casa y también sale a predicar en sus ratos libres.  Es separada de su esposo y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, de 15 y 17 años, quienes estudian en el colegio fiscal de su área.  Ahora requiere el préstamo para comprar multivitaminas y otros productos naturales.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in the Suburbio sector of Guayaquil.  Years ago, she began selling clothes on credit and later offered a line of cosmetics.  She now also sells Herbalife natural products.  The borrower works alone most of the time, but sometimes she receives help from her oldest child with collecting payments.  She conducts her business at home, but she also leaves to do promotions in her free time.  The borrower is separated from her husband and has two teenage children, ages 15 and 17, who attend a state high school in the area.  

For now, she is requesting a loan in order to buy multivitamins and other natural products.

loans.use: to buy multivitamins and other natural products.

loans.name: Raul Diosdado

texts.en:
Raul Diosdado is 50 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are still in school.

Raul Diosdado is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Raul Diosdado requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for his pigs.

Raul Diosdado has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Raul Diosdado would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for his pigs.

loans.name: Kadiatu         M

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children ages 14 and 23. Her children are going to school. 

Kadiatu runs a pharmacy in Waterloo community. She sells a variety of medical drugs such as malarial drugs, blood syrup, and cholera drugs. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business six days per week from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. Kadiatu describes her major problems as poor electrical supply and transportation of the drugs from Freetown to her store house.  

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more malarial drugs, blood syrup and cholera drugs. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and improve her level of living. 

In the future, she plans to open a hospital and employ the youth in that particular community. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more malarial drugs, blood syrup and cholera drugs for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a married woman who has ten children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ana is 62 years old, and she has a business, selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Ana requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ludis Analy

texts.es:
Doña Ludis con 30 años de edad es agricultura y ama de casa, madre de 5 hijos los cuales dependen de ella y su compañero de hogar. Doña Ludis piensa que nunca es tarde para aprender y para estudiar por lo que ella en la actualidad está cursando el sexto grado ya que cuando estaba joven no pudo estudiar. Su hija mayor está cursando el segundo año del plan básico en una comunidad cercana, la segunda hija tiene 13 años y está cursando el sexto grado en la escuela de la comunidad, el tercer hijo tiene 11 años y está cursando el cuarto grado, el cuarto hijo tiene 8 años y está en segundo grado y la última tiene 3 años y todos viven con ella. Ella es agricultora y se dedica al cultivo de café, maíz y frijoles aunque solo para consumo de su hogar ella aprendió a realizar estas actividades desde muy pequeña ya que sus padres se dedicaron a este rubro desde toda una vida. La tierra que trabajan en familia es propia y la han adquirido con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación por varios años. Al final de la cosecha su producto lo venden con intermediarios que se trasladan hasta la comunidad para comprar producto de buena calidad y con un precio razonable. 

Su meta a largo plazo es sacar su bachillerato y poder culminar una carrera universitaria y así sentir el orgullo de sus hijos y pueda ser ejemplo para que ellos puedan ser profesionales también. Es por esa razón que ella diariamente trabaja duro en compañía de su conyugue por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 8 QQ de urea, 8 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 8 QQ de fórmula 18-26-0 para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Doña Ludis is a 30-year-old farmer who also, with the help of her partner, cares for her five children. She believes that it's never too late to study and learn, so she's currently studying at a sixth grade level because she didn't have the chance to go to school as a child. 

Doña Ludis' children are, from oldest to youngest: a daughter who is in her second year at a high school that she attends in a nearby town, a 13-year-old daughter in sixth grade in a local school, an 11-year-old son in the fourth grade, an eight-year-old boy in second grade, and a three-year-old daughter. All of the children live with Doña Ludis.
