Doña Ludis is a farmer who grows coffee, as well as corn and beans, although those two crops are only for the family's consumption. Doña Ludis' parents taught her to farm when she was very young, sharing with her a lifetime of experience. The family owns its the land it farms, having acquired it through years of hard work and dedication. After the harvest, Doña Ludis sells her crops to wholesalers who travel through the region purchasing high-quality produce at reasonable prices. 

Doña Ludis' long-term goal  is to earn first a high school diploma and then a university degree. Higher education will make her children proud of her; they'll see that she's a role model for them and that they can also achieve professional careers for themselves.  

These aspirations are the motivations for Doña Ludis and her partner to strive diligently each day. Their goals are also the reason she is applying for a loan that she'll use to purchase eight quintales of urea, and eight quintales each of 12-24-12 and 18-26-0 fertilizers to cultivate and sustain her coffee crop.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
This is Joseph, 39, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. He is married to Digna, his business partner, and they have children. He and his wife manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.  

Joseph operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. 

He also has a variety store for additional income. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Joseph dreams that his business will get bigger and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Noern

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district, Noern, 38, has six children. Noern has been farming rice for almost 20 years. The current business earns her about 12,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Noern has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now requesting a loan of 610,000 Cambodia Riel (KHR), she will use this loan to pay for labor fees. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and grow more rice to better her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 37 years of age, a married member, and lives in Looc Estaka, Dipolog City. She has four children - one infant and three adults. 

Her business activity is buying and selling fish. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns PHP 1,400 a week. Joy is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) since May 16, 2012. 

Mrs. Joy in now having a new loan amounting to PHP 6,000 for her additional capital for buying and selling fish.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married with five children. She is 39 years old and lives in Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur.

She sells bananaque and rice cakes to earn a living and has had this business for more than a year. She has requested a loan to restock necessary ingredients for her business.

She has been a member of PMPC for less than year. In the future, Wilma hopes to expand her little stall into a bigger one and be known by the food products she makes.

loans.use: to restock necessary ingredients for her business.

location.town: Pagadian - Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Grupo C Group

texts.es: El grupo C está integrado por tres integrantes que son familiares, ellos pertenecen a una comunidad muy tranquila aun esta dentro de la zona del municipio de San Felipe del Progreso. Es la primera vez que están solicitando crédito a VisionFund Mexico y KIVA. Arturo quien quedo como representante del grupo platica tener 35 años de edad vive en unión libre con la señora María juntos han formado una familia con tres niños dos de sus hijos se encuentran estudiando el preescolar. Arturo platica “Nos vimos obligados a solicitar un crédito porque mi papá nos inscribió a un apoyo de gobierno, solicitamos una tienda de abarrotes en el proyecto nos encontramos los tres integrantes del grupo, nuestra solicitud fue aprobada nos entregaran el efectivo para que nosotros compremos los productos de abarrotes, sin embargo nos están solicitando un porcentaje igual en efectivo, es por eso que estamos solicitando el crédito, nosotros estamos muy agradecidos y comprometidos con la institución porque para nosotros es una muy buena oportunidad tener un nuevo negocio propio” Las encargadas de la tienda de abarrotes serán Irma y Azucena. Ningún de ellos  han tenido un negocio es la primera vez tiene muchas esperanzas por que todo salga bien, el sueño de los tres es llegar a independizarse cada uno con sus negocios correspondientes para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The C group consists of three members who are family members and belong to a very peaceful community which is part of the municipality of San Felipe del Progreso.  This is the first time they are requesting a loan from Vision Fund México and Kiva.  

Arturo is the group representative.  He relates that he’s 35-years-old and in a common law relationship with María.  They have formed a family together with three children two of which are in pre-school.  Arturo relates: “We were obliged to request a loan because my father signed us up for government assistance program.  We requested a grocery store.  The three members of the group are in the project.  Our request was approved and we will get the cash so that we can buy the groceries.  However, they are asking us for an equal percentage in cash and this is why we are requesting the loan.  We are very grateful and committed to the institution because for us having a business of our own is a very good opportunity.”

Irma and Azucena will manage the grocery store.  None of them have ever had a business; this is their first time and they are very hopeful that everything will turn out well.  The dream the three of them share is for each one of them to become independent with their respective businesses to improve their families’ quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for their store.

location.town: La Purisima Concepcion Mayorazgo, San Felipe del P

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is married with five children. She is 43 years old and lives in Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur.

She sells viands (prepared food) and canned goods to earn a living and has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan to replace her supply of food items to sell.

She has been a member of PMPC for less than a year. In the future, Gertrudes hopes to have a catering service and make her little store into a larger one.

loans.use: to replace her supply of food items to sell

location.town: Pagadian - Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is married with 4 children. She is 45 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and other supplies used for coconut production. In the future, Julieta hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other supplies used for coconut production.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is married with one child. Jonathan is 30 years old and lives in Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur.
To earn a living, Jonathan has had a piggery business for the last six years. Each month, he earns PHP 5,000 doing this business. 

He requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more herds of pigs to raise.

Jonathan has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Jonathan hopes to have more capital so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more herds of pigs to raise

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 49 years old and lives in Paglaum, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with two children.

Flora has a shop that sells a variety of goods. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan to purchase more stock like canned goods, noodles, detergents and rice to sell.

Flora has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to expand her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, noodles, detergents and rice to sell.

loans.name: Amela

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Amela works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. She is borrowing 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Amela has been sustaining her business activities through seven prior loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of bananas to sell through her buy-and-sell banana business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire, 33, has three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years.

Marie Claire has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, such as juice, coffee, vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, eggs and other groceries.

In the future, Marie Claire would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as juice, coffee, vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, eggs and other groceries.

loans.name: Escolastica Massiel

texts.es:
Escolástica es una joven estudiante de medicina quien solicita un préstamo para poder concluir sus estudios, esta es u historia: Hola mi nombre es Massiel, tengo 24 años, actualmente vivo en Altos de Rafey con un familiar, como no soy de esta ciudad, a veces me veo forzada a cambiar de hogar constantemente pues no soy de Santiago y no tengo familiares directos aquí, nací y me crie en un campo de Altamira, Puerto plata, allí me crie con mis padres y curse mis estudios primarios en una pequeña escuelita, la cual me quedaba un poco distanciada y tenía que ir a pie, pero yo iba muy feliz porque siempre me ha gustado estudiar.

Mi papa es agricultor, ama trabajar la tierra, esa es su pasión y nuestro medio de sostén, mientras que mi mama se dedica a cuidar el hogar y la familia.

Estoy cursando mis estudios de la carrera de medicina en la Universidad Tecnológica de Santiago (UTESA)
Cuando era pequeña me gustaba cuidar los animalitos y cuando llovía yo andaba cuidándolos y tapándolos de la lluvia y allí un día acostada en mi cama me pregunte como podía ayudar a los demás y me acordaba de aquellas batas blancas que veía cuando iba al hospital del campo, esas personas que estaban al servicio de la gente, ayudando y en esa cama me dije a mi misma voy hacer Doctora.
Me gusta la carrera de medicina por las siguientes razones:

Porque amo el estudio de la vida y la forma en que puedo ayudar a las personas a prevenir, mantener y restaurar su salud, porque quiero ayudar a las personas que sufren, que padecen dolor y que se encuentran desesperados por una mano que les alivie, porque ayudar a las personas me da una satisfacción inmensa y pues pienso que a cada persona Dios le envía a la tierra con una misión y le da una destreza y una virtud a cada uno y he encontrado la mía.

Día a día quiero mejorarla porque siento que con mi esfuerzo, mi entrega y mi dedicación puedo hacer mucho y que Dios me utilizara como instrumento para llegar hasta aquellos que luchan por vivir, por combatir una enfermedad y que tienen un futuro por delante.

Necesito ayuda de este préstamo porque provengo de una familia de bajos recursos, por lo que se les hace difícil costear mis estudios y con dicho préstamo tendría un mejor rendimiento, ya que podría llevar mayor cantidad de materias y no habría limitaciones; de no recibir el préstamo continuaría luchando por mi sueño, sé que me llevaría más  tiempo, pero rehusó a rendirme. Este préstamo afectaría mi vida de manera positiva, porque me llevaría al lugar donde quiero estar, mi meta, mi sueño y lo haría de una forma más rápida, constante y segura.

Mis metas académicas son: tener buen rendimiento académico, aprender para mi vida y mi profesión y no para el momento, unas vez terminada la Universidad mi visión es ser especialista y ser un medico brillante que hace bien su trabajo y se preocupa por sus pacientes.
En cuanto a lo familiar y lo personal:

Quiero ayudar a mi familia para que puedan disfrutar de mejor calidad de vida y creo en la familia y en el amor, por lo que me gustaría tener mi propia familia y ser un ejemplo a seguir en ella, darle a conocer al campo que alguien corriente como yo con coraje y pasión puede lograr lo que nadie pudo imaginarse que yo sería una doctora.

Cuando termine la carrera: 
Quiero especializarme en cirugía general, tener mi consultorio para trabajar, saldar mis deudas, mejorar mi calidad de vida y ayudar a todas las personas que me necesiten.
Hacer operativos médicos para que las personas de bajos recursos se puedan atender y tener consultas y medicinas.
texts.en:
Escolástica is a young medical student who is asking for a loan in order to be able to finish her studies. This is her story: Hello my name is Massiel. I am 24 years old. I currently live in Altos de Rafey with a family member, since I am not from this city. Sometimes I find myself forced to move constantly because I am not from Santiago and I do not have immediate family members here. I was born and raised in the town of Altamira, Puerto Plata. I grew up there with my parents and went to primary school in a small little school, which was a little far away from me and I had to walk, but I went very happily because I have always liked to study.

My father is a farmer. He loves to work the land. This is his passion and our means of support, while my mother takes care of the home and the family.

I am pursuing my studies in medicine at the Santiago University of Technology (UTESA). 

When I was young, I liked to take care of the animals, and when it rained, I would go take care of them and cover them from the rain and there one day lying in my bed I asked myself how I could help others and I remembered those white lab coats I saw when I went to the rural hospital. Those people who were at the service of the people, helping, and in that bed I said to myself I am going to be a doctor.

I like the career of medicine for the following reasons:

Because I love the study of life and the way I can help people to prevent, to maintain and restore their health, because I want to help people who suffer, who are in pain and who find themselves desperate for a helping hand, because helping people gives me immense satisfaction and I think that God sends each person to earth with a mission and gives a skill and a virtue to each one and I have found mine.

Day by day I want to improve it because I feel that with my effort, my devotion, and my dedication I can do a lot and that God will use me as an instrument to reach those who are fighting to live and to combat a disease and that they have a future ahead of them.

I need the help of this loan because I come from a family with few resources, so it is difficult for them to pay for my studies, and with this loan I would do better, because I would be able to take a greater number of subjects and there would not be any limitations. Without receiving this loan, I would continue fighting for my dream; I know that it would take me more time, but I refuse to give up. This loan would affect my life in a positive way, because it would bring me to the place I want to be, my goal, my dream, and I would do it in a faster, continuous, and secure way.

My academic goals are: to do well academically, to learn for my life and my profession and not for the moment. Once I finish at the University my vision is to be a specialist and a brilliant physician who does her work well and cares about her patients.

Regarding my family and personal life:

I want to help my family so that they can enjoy the best quality of life. I believe in family and love, so I would like to have my own family and be an example to follow in it, to let the town know that someone ordinary like me can with courage and passion achieve what nobody was able to imagine – that I would be a doctor.

When I finish my studies:

I want to specialize in general surgery, have my office to work in, pay my debts, improve my quality of life and help all the people who need me. I want to do medical clinics so that people with few resources can come in and have office visits and medicines.

loans.use: to cover the registration fees for her medical studies and books

loans.name: Maitta F.

texts.en:
Maitta is 40 years old, and lives in Logan Town with her husband and two children ages 6 and 19, who go to school. 

She has been running a table where she sells fish to make ends meet. She says with her business she is able to send her children to school. She says she started this business by helping her mother in the local market. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fish for her business. Her plans are to expand her business even more, and in the future hopes to see her children through high school and attending college.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 33 years old and lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. she is single and has five children between the ages of 4 and 17. Her children are presently in school and live at home. She is an elementary dropout. 

For the past nine years, she has been running a shop where she sells rice and soup. She started this business with money from her boyfriend. With this little money, she managed to established her business and learned ways of selling from her friends.

She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profit and it keeps her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, vita, pepper, oil, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house and improve her children's living conditions even more.

loans.use: to buy rice, vita, pepper, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 35 years old and lives in Logan Town. She is single and has three children between the ages of 7 and 20. Three of them are attending school and live at home. Betty has been operating a provisions shop for the past five years now. She sells soap, toothpaste, rice, oil, tissue and batteries amongst other things. She has only a small amount of capital to operate her business, and she requested a loan to purchase more rice, oil, soap, tissue, batteries and toothpaste for her business. She plans to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, soap, tissue, batteries and toothpaste for her business

loans.name: Marademe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   MARADEME est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 10éme prêt. Les 9 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de riz
à l’image de  FANTA qui est la 1ére femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 400Kg de riz  avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The MARADEME group consists of five married women who are, on average, 37 years old and also have an average of four children each. They all live in the village of Méridièla, in extended traditional families that include their husbands, husbands' brothers, co-wives and sons of the family.  They know one another through neighborhood, friendship and business ties.

In order to strengthen their financial capacity and to improve their businesses, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their tenth loan.  Their nine previous loans were duly repaid.

This group of women, including FANTA (the featured borrower) sells rice.  Fanta is the woman standing first from the left in the photo.  

She plans to use her loan to buy 400 kg of rice from wholesalers in Bamako.  She resells her merchandise at the market and from home, for cash and on credit, to a customer base which mostly consists of women.  

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her activities and also used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy some rice.

loans.name: Hector Amilcar

texts.es: Héctor, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida.  Anteriormente trabajo en la agricultura, y hace un año con 8 meses que se dedica a la elaboración de tajadas de plátano. El producto es elaborado y lo vende en bolsas por libras luego sale a vender de manera ambulante. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo en ODEF que es por 7,000 Lempiras, para surtir de materia prima como bananos verdes, sal, aceite, bolsas, grapas y otros con el propósito de incrementar las ventas y ampliar su mercado. Su meta es  lograr mejorar su calidad de vida, quiere terminar de instalar la energía eléctrica en su casa y también piensa vender otro tipo de comidas.
texts.en: Hector is 36 years old, married, has three children and lives in the municipality of Tela, Atlantida.  He has previously worked in agriculture, a year and eight months ago he started working making plantain chips.  The product is prepared and sold in bags by the pound, he goes out to sell informally.  He is requesting a loan to ODEF for 7,000 HNL, to purchase ingredients and materials such as green plantains, salt, oil, bags, staples and other items with the purpose to increase sales and expand his market.  His goal is to improve his quality of life, he wants to finish installing electricity in his house and thinks of selling other types of food.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials such as green plantains, salt, oil, bags, staples and other items

loans.name: Jimmy Alexander

texts.es:
Jimmy tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la ciudad  de Piura, Jimmy para poder solventar los gastos del hogar trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y recorre todas las calles de la ciudad en busca de sus clientes, Jimmy cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es responsable al conducir.

Jimmy está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras a su vehículo en especial el mantenimiento de su vehículo, de esta manera podrá conducir un vehículo en buenas condiciones y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una flota de taxis”.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 35 years old and lives in the city of Piura. Jimmy works as a motorcycle taxi driver in order to be able to pay his costs of living. He works about 10 hours a day and covers all the streets of the city in search of customers. Jimmy feels things are going well for him in his job because he is very friendly with customers and most of all because he is a responsible driver.

Jimmy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the aid that they have given him he will be able to perform improvements to his vehicle, especially its maintenance. Because of this he will be able to drive a vehicle in good condition and continue working to achieve his greatest dream: "to have a fleet of taxis".

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru:
Хикматулло бизнесмен по оптовым продажам, проживающим в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 52 года. Он женат, имеет двоих сыновей и двоих дочерей. В данный момент его старший сын и оба дочерей обзаведены семьями и живут отдельно.
 Хикматулло занимается купле-продажей тканей и мателиалов более 10 лет. Он оптом закупает свой товар с оптового рынка Душанбе и оптом же продает его на рынках городов Кургантюбе и Худжанд. Хикматулло в бизнесе помогает его младший сын. Он учит его своему делу. В этом деле им больше нравится увеличение прибыли. Хайрулло сейчас необходимо закупить очередную партию товара для расширения бизнеса. Для осуществления этой цели он просит кредит.
texts.en: Hikmatullo is a businessman in the city of Tursunzoda who works in wholesale. He is 52 and married and has two sons and two daughters. His older son and both daughters have started families and live on their own. Hikmatullo has been making a living buying and selling fabric and materials for more than 10 years. He buys his inventory wholesale from the market in Dushanbe and sells it wholesale in the markets in the cities of Kurgan-Tyube and Khujand. His younger son helps him with the business and Hikmatullo is training him in his work. At this point they would like to increase their revenues. Hayrullo now needs to purchase the next shipment of goods to expand the business. To fulfill this goal he is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials for resale

loans.name: Fatmata      B

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata. She is a 38-year-old from Tombo, a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 7 years and 15 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2005, Fatmata established a general merchandise business within a busy market area.   She began her business because she changed her status of living; she works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that during rainy season sales are very slow.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase milk, sugar, cigarettes, soap and drinks for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and repay her loan. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand and open another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, cigarettes, soap and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Isacc Leopoldo

texts.es:
Isacc tiene 22 años, vive al lado de su esposa con quien tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho y por los cuales trabaja muy duro cada día, ya que Isacc para poder mantener a su familia logro iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, Isacc trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y los fines de semana puede trabajar hasta 11 horas al día, Isaac cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo ofrece productos a precios cómodos y de calidad.

Isaac está muy agradecido con los  prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar una congeladora para su negocio, de esta manera conservar sus productos en buen estado y con ello mejorara aun más la atención a sus clientes, así mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá en la lucha de hace realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un minimarket y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Isacc is 22 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children aged 7 and 4 years old. He loves them very much and works hard for them every day. He can support his family having been able to start his store selling groceries and drinks. Isacc works about 9 hours a day and on week-ends up to 11 hours daily. He feels that his business is going well as he treats his customers well and offers them quality products at a good price. 

Isacc is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help he can buy a freezer for his store. Now he can keep his products in good condition and with that offer better service to his customers. He will increase his profits and continue in the struggle to achieve his greatest dream. "to own a mini-market and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Akpénè

texts.fr:
Akpénè   âgée de 37 ans est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle habite le village de Ségbé.  Depuis 2008  elle vendait des petits poissons et l’huile végétale mais par manque de fonds elle a commencé le petit commerce de pétrole vu que dans son village il n’y a pas d’électricité et la demande est forte. Elle a associé à son activité la vente des médicaments traditionnels pour traiter les maux de ventre et aider ceux qui n'ont pas de moyen dans leur village pour se faire consulter à l’hôpital. Avec ce crédit Akpénè pourra non seulement s’approvisionner en pétrole au moins trois fois par mois au lieu de deux fois par semaine et réduire  les charges sur déplacement et aussi acheter 2 bidons de boisson alcoolisée pour faire ses médicaments.  
Les revenus de son activité lui permettront d’aider son mari dans les dépenses du ménage.
texts.en:
Akpénè is 37 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She lives in the village of Ségbé.  She had been selling small fish and vegetable oil since 2008, but for lack of money she has now become involved in another small retail business, selling petroleum.  There is no electricity in her village and the demand for petroleum is high.  Additionally, she sells traditional medication to cure stomach aches and this helps the people in her village who do not have the means to seek treatment at the hospital.

With this loan, Akpénè will be able to buy some petroleum at least three times per month (instead of twice a week), therefore reducing her transportation costs.  She will also be able to buy two cans of alcoholic drinks to prepare her medications.

She will use the profits from her business to help her husband with the household's expenses.

loans.use: to buy four cans of petroleum and two cans of alcoholic drink.

loans.name: Elerti

texts.en:
Elerti is being photographed in-front of his animal stable. He is a 24-year-old, recently married village guy with a one-year-old child. 

“When I turned 18, I went to Greece for work and I did work for two years, thanks to the Greeks who gave me the opportunity. With the money I made there, I came back to my village and purchased two dairy cows. So, since my return, I have been taking care of our animals and selling their raw milk to the dairy farm in our village,” said Elerti.

The soil in his village, and generally in the entire region, grows good potatoes, and many residents take advantage of this. Now Elerti also wants to buy potato seeds/seedlings to plant, and this is the reason for this loan.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Maria Auristela

texts.es:
Doña María es una señora de 54 años de edad curso hasta el primer año de la primaria y es madre de 8 hijos de los cuales 7 ya son adultos, en hogares a parte y solo uno vive con ellos el cual tiene 21 años de edad curso el segundo año de carrera que no termino por decisión propia ya que decidió apoyar a su padre en los quehaceres del campo. Ellos en familia se desempeñan en la siembra, cultivo de café y granos básicos en pequeña producción el cual le sirve de sustento a su familia y en ocasiones vende parte de su producción. Doña María se ha dedicado a este rubro desde hace más de 40 años ya que este tipo de actividad viene de generaciones, el grano de café lo vende en oro y lo hacen por medio de intermediarios ya que así se evitan hacer el gasto de trasladarlo a las bodegas en donde es almacenado y vendido el producto. Sus cultivos una parte están ubicadas aproximadamente a 5 minutos y la otra parte a 15 minutos en carro.

Su mayor meta es que sus hijos obtengan un mejor patrimonio dejando un techo digno y tierras para que las puedan trabajar. Su sueño es que su hijo menor se gradúe de la universidad y considera que con el apoyo que hoy en día solicita a la cooperativa COMIXMUL solicitando un financiamiento podrá lograr este proyecto ya que su necesidad en este momento es poder darle asistencia a sus cultivos de café comprando 8 QQ de urea, 8 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 8 QQ de fórmula 18-26-0.
texts.en:
María is a 54 year old woman. She is the mother of eight children. Seven of them are adults and live in their own homes. Only one, a 21 year old, lives at home with them. He decided to stop school in the second year of university and  help his father with the work in the fields. As a family they plant and grow coffee and other basic grains on a small scale, which serves to sustain the family and occasionally they sell part of their product. 

María has worked in this field for more than 40 years now. It is a tradition that goes back generations in her family. She sells the coffee beans "en oro" (separated from the outer skin or fruit and polished) through intermediaries so they avoid paying the shipping cost to the warehouse. It is stored and sold there. Her fields are about five minutes away by car and another part 15 minutes away. Her goal is for her children to receive a better inheritance, leaving a solid house and land they can work. 

María's dream is for her youngest son to finish university. She considers that the assistance she is requesting from COMIXMUL will help her achieve this project. What she needs right now is to help her coffee crops buying 8 quintals of urea, 8 quintals of Formula 12-24-12 and 8 quintals of Formula 18-26-0.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Las Semillitas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Semillitas”  está conformada por 06 socios,  que se encuentra pasando el 14 ciclo, dicho grupo en el transcurso del tiempo han demostrado ser personas trabajadores y responsables. Maruja una de las socias se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves  como gallinas, patos, pollos y  pavos. Esto surgió con los deseos de contar con un negocio propio. Pues gracias a su perseverancia ha mejorado su vivienda. El deseo de Maruja es de mejorar su negocio comprando más aves. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará  para la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales. Maruja de 50 años es separada con 03 hijos independientes. El grupo “Las Semillitas” agradecen el crédito brindado. Maruja se encuentra sentada viste casaca marón.
texts.en:
The Las Semillitas (Little Seeds) communal bank is composed of 6 members and is completing its 14th cycle. Over time, the members of this group have demonstrated themselves to be hard-working and responsible people. 

Maruja, one of the members, raises and sells poultry such as hens, ducks, chickens, and turkeys. This began with her desire to have her own business. Thanks to her perseverance, she has improved her home. Maruja wants to improve her business by purchasing more birds. This loan will be used to purchase feed for her animals. Maruja, 50 years old, is separated with 3 adult children. 

The Las Semillitas group appreciates the loans provided. Maruja is seated, dressed in a brown jacket.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a hardworking man who lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He operates a motorcycle business that has been in operation for the past three years.

His major challenge is motorcycle breakdown and the need to buy spare parts. He will use the requested KES 40,000 loan to purchase spare parts and service the motorcycle.

Suleiman joined Yehu and Kiva to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and service the motorcycle.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José, tienen 55 años de edad, esta casado, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de La Masica, Atlántida.  Hace 10 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de jugos de caña.  Este producto lo elabora y lo vende en bolsa en el mercado. Ha solicitado otro  préstamo por 17000 Lempiras siendo este el tercer ciclo en ODEF, el cual lo va invertir en el mantenimiento del molino de moler caña y compra de caña, bolsa, pajillas para vender el jugo. Este préstamo le ayudara a aumentar el negocio y a obtener mejores ganancias. Su meta es crecer con el negocio para el bienestar personal y de la familia.
texts.en: José is 55 years old, married, has four children and lives in the municipality of La Masica, Atlántida. For the past ten years he has worked making and selling sugar cane juice. He produces the product and sells it by the bag in the market. He has requested another loan of 17,000 HNL. This is his third cycle with ODEF. He will invest it in the maintenance of his sugar cane mill and buy sugar cane, bags and straws to sell the juice. This loan will allow him to expand his business and create greater revenues. His goal is to make his business bigger for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his sugar cane mill, buy sugar cane, bags and straws to sell the juice.

loans.name: Percy Washintong

texts.es:
Percy vive en la ciudad de Carhuaz, es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo porque vive al lado de sus 2 hijos de 12 y 7 años a quienes saca adelante con los ingresos de su humilde negocio de venta de joyas, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día, Percy cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque desea superarse.

Percy esta my agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar más joyas y así poder tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer, y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Percy lives in the city of Carhuaz. He is a hard-working man, chiefly because he lives alongside his two children, ages 12 and 7, whom he supports with the income from his small jewel-selling business. He works around 9 hours per day. Percy feels that his business is moving forward because he is very responsible and, above all, because he wants to get ahead in life. 

Percy is very grateful to Kiva's small lenders as thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to purchase more gems and thus have a greater variety of products to offer. He will continue to fight to realize his greatest dream: to provide his children with a profession.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (gems)

loans.name: Ivette Del Carmen

texts.es: Ivette es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Tiene 26 años de edad,casada. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de calzado  desde hace 6 años. Considera que su negocio es rentable, ya que le ayudo a crecer económicamente. Solicita el  crédito para comprar: sandalias, deportivos, zapatos de niños, chinelas, entre otros con el fin de diversificar su negocio, aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos. Estima que el financiamiento será  gran oportunidad, ya que podrá comprar los productos que necesita para satisfacer a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es ampliar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ivette is a native of the city of Granada. She is 26 years old and married. She is a merchant and has been selling shoes for the past 6 years. She considers her business profitable, as it helps her to grow economically. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase sandals, sneakers, children's shoes, slippers, and other products with the aim of diversifying her business, increasing her sales, and obtaining a higher income. She sees this financing as a great opportunity, as she will be able to purchase the products she needs to satisfy her customers. Her future plan is to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase sandals, sneakers, children's shoes, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Konah

texts.en:
Konah is 40 year old and Lives in Logan Town. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have four children between the ages of 3 and 20, two of whom attend school.

Konah has been operating a shop selling charcoal for the past five years. She says sometimes she experiences losses, but not all of the time.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She hopes to extend her business in other local markets and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en:
Mirjana wants to buy potato seeds for planting. What you see in the background of the photograph is her house, the stable and the hay barn. She is 37, and has three young-aged children. 

Mirjana has been in the livestock type of activity for the past ten years and has been selling raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. 

Here is what she said to the officer who interviewed her: “Our village is struck by extreme cold and snowy winters. So, we have to make sure that our animals stay warm and inside in their stables throughout the cold weather. As soon as we see some sun rays coming down, we take the animals out of their stable so that they breathe some fresh air. We must take great care of our animals, because we secure our staple food for our children, but this wouldn’t be enough if we didn’t sell some agricultural products, such as grain, red onions and potatoes.”

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: finish building an enclosing wall on the back of his home.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa,  Victor se dedica a la agricultura, oficio con el cual ha podido sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, quienes ya son mayores. Victor le gusta mucho lo que hace, actualmente ha sembrado maíz, por ello cada día le dedica a su cultivo alrededor de 9 horas al día; Victor cree que esta le va bien en su cultivo porque es responsable y sobre todo cuidadoso.

Victor está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono, solventar los gastos de regadío, entre otros, con lo cual podrá mejorar su cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha, así mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una movilidad para transportar su cultivo”.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the city of Pucallpa. He is engaged in agriculture, an occupation through which he has been able to support his 2 children, who are now grown. Victor loves what he does. Currently he has planted corn, and each day he dedicates himself to cultivation for around 9 hours. Victor believes that his crops are coming along well because he is responsible and, above all, careful. 

Victor is grateful to Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided he will be able to purchase fertilizer and manure and pay for irrigation, among other things, with which he can improve his crops and ensure a good harvest. This way, he will improve his income and continue fighting to realize his greatest dream: buying a vehicle to transport his harvest.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Adolfina

texts.es:
Doña Adolfina es una mujer de 45 años de edad  años de edad casada y madre de 6 hijos los cuales son menores de edad estudian en diferentes grados de educación en la primaria y dependen de ella y de su esposo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleto cursado hasta el 4 grado y se dedica al cultivo de hortaliza como ser: papa, brócoli, coliflor, lechuga, repollo, etc. como también la siembra de granos básicos como el frijol hace más de 10 años en compañía de su esposo. El terreno que ella y su esposo trabajan es propio gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres el cual está ubicado a 10 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan diariamente para limpiar y abonar sus cultivos. El producto es comercializado en el mercado local y vendido a los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona.

Doña Adolfina solicita ayuda para invertir en su cultivo comprando 11 QQ de semilla de papa certificada para su siembra, 10 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 8 kilos de manzate, 8 kilos de conter, 8 kilos de curion, 6 botes de muralla, 9 kilos de mancoceb y 10 QQ de gallinaza.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder mejorar sus cosechas implementando un sistema de riego para mantener saludable y alimentado el producto como también los de seguir cultivando pero en cantidad y calidad para ofrecer más a sus clientes y poder darle a sus hijos una buena educación a nivel superior.
texts.en:
Adolfina is a 45-year-old married mother of six young children. All of her children are in different grades of elementary school and depend upon her and her husband. She herself did not finish primary school, completing through the fourth grade before working full-time at growing vegetables such as potatoes, broccoli, cauliflower, lettuce and cabbage. She also grows simple grains such as beans. She and her husband have more than ten years of experience at this together. 

The land that they work is their own thanks to an inheritance from her parents. The land is located ten minutes away from their house, and they go there daily to tend, clean, and fertilize their crop. They then sell their products in the local market to various middlemen who come to the area.

Adolfina is requesting this loan which she will use to invest in her crops by purchasing a large amount of certified potato seed, fertilizer and organic compost, as well as additional fungicides and insecticides.

Her future plans are to improve her harvests with an irrigation system to keep her crops healthy and well fed. She will also continue to grow her crops with greater quality and quantity so that she can offer more of both to her customers. Ultimately, she hopes be able to give her children a good education through higher levels of schooling.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand his business and purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Modesta

texts.es: Maria Modesta tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea rural del Municipio de Lepaera, Departamento de Lempira. Ella tenia un negocio de pulperia anteriormente, pero siempre se a dedicado a la agricultura. actualmente solo atiende el cultivo de café junto con su esposo. la producción que obtiene la vende a intermediarios de la zona. Esta solicitando un cuarto ciclo de préstamo que es por 18,000 lempiras, el cual piensa invertir en compra de fertilizantes para mejorar la finca y la cosecha, también para preparar una manzana de terreno y sembrar café. Su plan es buscar obtener mejores ganancias para mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Maria Modesta is 31 years old and married, and she and her husband have two children. They live in a rural village near Lepaera, depatment of Lempira. She used to run a small corner store, but has always been involved in agriculture. Currently, she just sees to growing coffee alongside her husband. She sells her harvest to the middlemen in the area. She is requesting a fourth term on her loan for 18,000 lempiras, which she plans to invest in the purchase of fertilizers to improve her farm and her harvest. She will also prepare an acre of land to plant coffee. Her plan is to try and earn greater income so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and prepare land for growing coffee.

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Juana es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Tiene 61 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a brindar el servicio de alquiler de bicicletas desde hace 9 años, antes de iniciar con esta actividad, trabajo en otras empresas de las cuales recibe una pensión. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Bicicletas y darles mantenimiento a las que están en uso. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda para incrementar sus ingresos, ya que podrá invertir en su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de sus activos fijos. Su meta futuro es ampliar el área donde están sus bicicletas.
texts.en:
Juana is originally from Grenada. She is 61 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is a businesswoman and for the past nine years has operated a bicycle rental service. Before this she worked for other companies and receives a pension from this. She can also count on the support of her husband. 

Juana is asking for this loan to buy bicycles and to maintain the bikes she already has. She believes the loan will help a lot to increase her revenues as she can invest in her business and upgrade the condition of her fixed assets. Her future goal is to increase the size of the area where she keeps the bikes.

loans.use: to buy bicycles and upkeep the ones in use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: finish construction on his daughters' bedroom.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Nancy from Liberia. She lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well known. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have five children between the ages of 4 and 22, only three of whom are presently in school and live at home. She stopped education at sixth grade. 

For the past five years she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells rice and soup. She started this business by selling at a table market and later received money from her husband to change her business to a cook shop business. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she makes more profit every day and most interestingly she meets new people every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat, fish, pepper, oil, rice, etc. for her business. Her plan is to educate all her children. She appreciates BRAC Liberia and the lenders who support small business people.

loans.use: to purchase more meat, fish, pepper, oil, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a 24-year-old married woman. She has two children, an 8-year-old and a 13-year-old. She operates a store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are local individuals, commercial and institutional customers. 

Fridah describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals for resale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata, She is a 35-year-old from Waterloo, in the Eastern area of Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 years and 13 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. For the past seven years, Fatmata has established a business selling assorted drinks within the Waterloo community. She was a housewife. She began this business because she wanted to contribute to taking care of the children. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is during rainy season when sales are very slow.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more assorted drinks for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and repay her loan. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand and open another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks for resale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 37 years old and married.   She has seven children, ranging from 2 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be reliable. 

She operates a cereals store where she sells beans, peas and maize. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a profitable area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a low supply of stock, hence higher prices and lower profits. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy maize and beans for sale. 

Her business goal is to become the leading cereals trader in her area within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be profitable and self-sustaining. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy maize and beans for sale

loans.name: Saffiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old Saffiatu from Waterloo, in the Eastern area of Freetown. She is divorced with four children between the ages of 13 years and 27 years. Three of her children are attending school. She started this business because she needed to create a permanent source of income to support the home.  

Saffiatu runs a retail store. She sells toothpaste, soap, drinks and electronic devices. She has been running this business since 2007. She works at the business seven days, twelve hours per day.  Saffiatu says that the main challenge to her business is the fact that transporting her goods from the city to her business place is very difficult.

Saffiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase items including toothpaste, soap, drinks and electronic devices for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to buy a plot of land and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to build a permanent business location. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food items including toothpaste, soap, drinks and electronic devices for resale

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
This is Annie from Liberia.  She is 35 years old and has six children, ages between 6 and 22.  They live in Logan Town Area, one of the early communities in Liberia and well-known. She is married to a man who works at Freeport. Their children are presently in school. 

Annie finished 12th grade before starting her business ten years ago. She runs a shop selling rice and soup. She started her business with money from her husband and then learned the business from her friends.  She likes her business because she realizes a small profit. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, pepper, oil, vita, onions, etc., for her business.  Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, oil, vita, onions, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata. She is a 49-year-old from Waterloo, an eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. Two of her children are currently attending school. For the past 20 years, Fatmata has established a palm oil business in a particular market area. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income to support her children. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the high cost of transportation.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more local food like gallons of palm oil. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Fatmata plans to export her palm oil to a neighboring country. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more local food like gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es: Reyna es socia del grupo “El Buen Samaritano” y está conformada por 08 mujeres emprendedoras y solidarias dedicadas a diversas actividades de comercio. Reyna de 34 años es casada con 01 hijo menor de edad. Con los deseos de surgir Reyna inicia su negocio, la cual actualmente se dedica al tejido de chompas, chalinas, guantes y colchas. Comenzó con una máquina pues más adelante con sus ahorros  y  la ayuda de su pareja puedo comprar 02 máquinas más. Se siente feliz  pues gracias a su esfuerzo a podido mejorar su vivienda.  Reyna solicitó el crédito para la compra de su cuarta máquina de coser, pues esto le facilitará realizar su trabajo. Su mayor deseo es de formar su propio taller de tejido. El grupo “El Buen Samaritano” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Reyna es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo morado y casaca beige.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the "El Buen Samaritano" (The Good Samaritan) group, which is made up of 8 hardworking, caring women who work in various fields.  Reyna is 34 years old, is married, and has 1 young son.  Desiring to get ahead, Reyna started her own business, which currently involves sewing sweaters, scarves, gloves, and quilts.  She started with one sewing machine and later on (with her savings and help from her husband) she was able to buy 2 more machines.  She is happy because thanks to her efforts, she has been able to improve her home.

Reyna is asking for a loan to buy her 4th sewing machine, since this will make it easier for her to carry out her work.  Her greatest desire is to start her own sewing shop.

The "El Buen Samaritano" group thanks all those who have made this loan possible and they are committed to continuing to work hard.  Reyna is the first person on the right, wearing a purple shirt and beige jacket.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Heriberto Antonio

texts.es: Heriberto Antonio de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Es empleado, se dedica al aseo urbano, es un empleo humilde pero muy honrado, tiene muchos años en su labor. Heriberto es responsable y muy luchador siempre está buscando las mejores alternativas que le permitan darle una mejor vida a su familia; su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural y necesita hacer algunas mejoras; poner balcones y ventanas,  cambiar la lamina del techo para que no se filtre el agua en esta época de lluvia y terminar de construir un cuarto, está muy entusiasmado con las modificaciones, pues sabe que es para mayor comodidad y seguridad de los miembros de su hogar, pero Heriberto no cuenta con capital que lo respalde por eso se decidió a solicitarle a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar ventanas, las defensas de ventanas, lamina, ladrillos, cemento, entre otros. Heriberto está muy contento con la ayuda y  asegura que junto con su esposa harán lo posible por saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido.
texts.en:
Heriberto Antonio, 40 years old, lives with his wife and their three children in a house that they own. He is employed and works in urban waste management. It is a humble but very honorable job. Heriberto Antonio has been working in this post for many years. He is a responsible and determined man who is always seeking alternative opportunities to help provide his family with a better life. 

Heriberto Antonio's house is located in a rural area and he needs to make some improvements to it. He plans to install balconies and windows, as well as change the metal panels on his roof so that water doesn't leak into the house during rainy season, and finish building a bedroom. Heriberto Antonio is very excited about these modifications because he knows that it will make his family safer and more comfortable. However, he does't presently have enough capital to purchase everything he needs to carry out the home improvements. For this reason, he decided to request a loan from FUSAI in order to buy windows, window guards, sheet metal, bricks, cement, and other supplies. 

Heriberto Antonio is very happy with this help and he assures lenders that he and his wife will do everything possible to get out of debt in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy windows, window guards, sheet metal, bricks, and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: construct a fence for his yard.

loans.name: Elsy Danilbia

texts.es:
Elsy es una joven de 27 años de edad acompañada que de su relación tiene un hijo el cual vive en casa ya que es un menor de edad. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años la cual aprendió por medio de sus padres ya que ellos se dedican a la agricultura desde toda una vida. Tiene un grado de educación secundaria completo graduándose como bachiller en promoción social. Sus clientes son los vecinos que viven en los alrededores compradores que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto sano, cómodo y de calidad para revender.  

Ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de 10 QQ de fertilizante, 12 QQ de urea y 10 QQ de formula cafetalera para sus cultivos de café ya que su prioridad es poder sacar una buena cosecha y aprovecharla al máximo. 

Sus Planes para el futuro es ampliar sus cultivos de café sembrando una mejor y mayor variedad para ofrecer. Su sueño es darles una educación universitaria a su hijo apoyarlo al máximo en todo lo necesario y lo que este a su alcance para que él tenga una educación escolar, secundaria y universitaria digna y pueda con el tiempo ejercer.
texts.en:
Elsy is a young woman of 27. She is in a relationship from which she has a son, who lives at home since he is still a minor. She has worked for many years in agriculture, which she learned through her parents, since they worked in agriculture all their lives. She completed her secondary education, graduating with a degree in social work. 

Her customers are neighbors who live in the surrounding areas and buyers who come to the zone in search of a product that is wholesome, convenient, and of a quality to resell.

She is applying for a loan to purchase 10 quintals of fertilizer [a quintal is about 100 lbs], 12 quintals of urea, and 10 quintals of coffee-growing formula for her coffee plantings, since her priority is to be able to have a good harvest and take advantage of it to the maximum.

Her plans for the future are to expand her plantings of coffee, planting a better and greater variety to offer. Her dream is to give a university education to her son, to help him to the maximum in everything that is necessary and that is within her reach, so that he has a suitable elementary, secondary, and  and university education and, with time, can put it to use.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Gema Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Gema es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Tiene 30 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijas. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a  elaboración y venta de comida. Empezó esta actividad a la edad de 15 años. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación logro pagar sus estudios a través de las ganancias obtenidas de su venta de comida, comercializa sus productos en su casa. Solicita este crédito para comprar: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, verduras entre otros con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas y abtener mayores ingresos. Su plan futuro es tener una miscelánea en su casa.
texts.en:
Gema is originally from the city of Granada.  She is 30 years old, is married, and has two daughters.  She is a businesswoman and works preparing and selling food.  She started this job when she was 15 years old.  Thanks to her effort and dedication, she was able to pay for her education with what she made selling food.  She makes her food at her house.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, and other things.  In this way, she will be able to satisfy her customers, increase her sales, and obtain greater income.  Her plan for the future is to start a shop in her house.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Gabriela Elizabeth

texts.es: Gabriela de 19 años de edad, vive muy feliz en casa propia es una mujer muy trabajadora que vela por si misma y su esposo. Por como la admiran sus vecinos exclaman de ella que es responsable y muy carismática siempre anda alegre. Actualmente trabaja como cosmetóloga una sala de belleza cerca de su casa y su esposo es taxista juntos salen adelante mejorando su vida, poco a poco pagando los gatos del hogar. Ella ha tomando la decisión de adquirir un préstamo a FUSAI ya que no tiene el dinero suficiente y desea cambiar el techo de un corredor y para ello necesita comprar laminas nueva, clavos entre otros. Actualmente el techo está muy deteriorado y en esta época de lluvia les está siendo difícil convivir es dicho espacio. Por lo que espera pronto solventar este problema de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 19 years old. She very happily lives in a house that she owns. Gabriela is a hardworking woman who takes good care of herself and her husband. Admired by her neighbors, she is known for being so responsible, charismatic, and happy. Currently, Gabriela works as a cosmetologist in a beauty salon near her house. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and together they move forward, improving their lives little by little while paying their household expenses.

Gabriela is requesting a loan from FUSAI because she does not have enough money to replace the roof over a hallway. For this she needs to buy new metal panels, nails, and other supplies. As of now, the roof is dilapidated and will make this space hard to live in during the coming rainy season.  Gabriela hopes to resolve this problem with her home soon.

loans.use: to buy new galvanized metal panels for fixing her roof, among other supplies.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Doña Paula es una mujer de 45 años de edad luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria no completada es madre de 1 hijo el cual vive en bajo su techo de habitación siendo ellos tres los únicos que se involucran en las diferentes actividades del campo. Ella trabaja en la agricultura en lo que es la siembra de hortalizas (papa, brócoli y coliflor) que además practica en ocasiones la siembra de maíz y frijol. Dichas actividades las aprendió de sus padres quienes son agricultores desde toda una vida. Sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de 5 minutos de camino de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan en familia. Su producto es comercializado a través de intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos y amigos que conocen de su producto; pero como toda siembra y cultivo no deja de tener riesgo siendo estos las plagas y la variación de precios en el mercado. 

Actualmente solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la siembra de papa comprando semilla certificada ya que es más segura higiénica y limpia, por medio de esto ella podrá aumentar sus cultivos y obtener una mejor ganancia del mismo.

Su sueño es poder mejorar su vivienda, comprar con las ganancias otra clase de semillas para poder cultivar más hortaliza y poder brindar una variedad a sus clientes para su compra/venta.
texts.en:
Paula is a hardworking 45-year-old woman.  She went to first grade in elementary school but didn't finish it.  She has one son who lives under her roof.  The three of them are the only ones who are involved in the various farming endeavors that they do.  She works in farming in what is known as planting vegetables (potatoes, broccoli, and cauliflower).  In addition, at times she plants corn and beans.  She learned this profession from her parents, who have been farmers their whole lives.

Her crops are located 5 minutes from her house and she and her family walk there.  Her harvest is sold to neighbors and friends and also via distributors that come to the area.  However, like every harvest, there are always risks due to disease and price changes.

Currently, she is asking for help so she can invest in her potato crop by buying certified seed, since it is safer, healthier, and cleaner.  In this way, she will be able to increase her harvest and obtain a greater income from it.

Her dream is to be able to improve her home, use her income to buy another type of seed so she can grow more vegetables and be able to offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: buy farming supplies for her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Ufemia

texts.es: Ufemia de 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijas de 9 años y 18 años; Siendo una mujer admirada por su familia y amigos se siente orgullosa de si misma y su familia. Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad como huevos, leche, pan, macarrones entre otros. Es así como honradamente se gana la vida decentemente y posee muchos clientes ya que siempre trata de mantener la tienda surtida. Ufemia desea cambiar el techo de donde vive ya que tiene 19 años de vivir en su casa que es propia y por el tiempo ya se está dañando es por eso que desea reparar todo el techo de su vivienda, comprar tejas, cemento y arena. Cuenta con buenas referencias de pago.
texts.en:
Ufemia is 56 years old and lives with her husband and their two daughters, ages 9 and 18.  This woman is admired by her family and friends, which makes her feel proud.  Ufemia has a store where she sells basic necessities such as eggs, milk, bread, macaroni, and other products.  This allows her to make an honest and decent living.  She has many customers since she always tries to keep her store stocked.  

Ufemia wants to replace the roof of her home.  She has lived in her own house for 19 years and it has sustained damage over time.  For this reason, she wants repair the entire roof of her house.  She will buy tiles, cement, and sand.  Ufemia has good payment references.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement, and sand for repairing the roof of her house.

loans.name: Patricia Arely

texts.es: Patricia Arely de 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo; Es una mujer muy visionaria que lo da y entrega todo por su familia, es trabajadora, servicial, respetuosa y muy emprendedora. Desde hace ya 10 años reside en casa humilde pero propia y poco a poco la ha ido construyendo ya que ella dice que le estará brindando una buena vivienda a su hijo. Ella se gana la vida vendiendo pan de dulce, y a la vez vende sandalias. Su esposo trabaja como motorista. Patricia desea con tanto esmero pavimentar el piso de su vivienda actualmente el piso es de tierra y para la salud y comodidad de su familia hará todo el esfuerzo para hacerlo, es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena, grava entre otros, y así está mas que segura que su familia estará muy contenta con la realización de este sueño.
texts.en: Patricia Arely, 25, lives with her husband and their small son. She is a very visionary women who gives everything for her family; she is hard-working, helpful, considerate and very enterprising. For 10 years she has been living in a house that is very humble but is her own and little by little she has been adding to it since she says that she will be providing a good home to her son. She earns a living selling pan de dulce [sweet breads/pastries] and selling sandals at the same time.Her husband works as a driver. Patricia wants to carefully pave the floor of her house. Right now the floor is dirt and for her family's health and comfort she will work hard to complete this. This is why she is seeking a loan from FUSAI for the purchase of cement, sand, gravel, etc. She is quite certain that her family will be very happy with the fulfillment of this dream.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, etc. in order to pave the floor of her home.

loans.name: Mónica Liliana

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Machala.  Empezó su actividad a raíz de su último embarazo, porque necesitaba tener ingresos y su esposo le ayuda a colocar una tienda y comedor, con el cual se ha mantenido hasta el día de hoy.  Trabaja 3 días a la semana en la venta de comida y los demás días se dedica a la venta de zapatos y cosméticos.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja como carnicero.  Tiene 4 hijos, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Aspira en un futuro a tener el negocio en su casa, mantener el restaurante en el mercado de la ciudad y que sus hijos estén siempres saludales.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Machala.  She started her business after her last pregnancy because she needed income.  Her husband helped her set up a store and a diner, both of which she has managed to this very day.  She works three days a week selling food and on the other days she sells shoes and cosmetics.  The borrower is married and her husband works as a butcher.  They have four children who attend a state school in the neighborhood.  

In the future, she aspires to have a business in her house, maintain a restaurant in the city market, and see that her children remain healthy.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en: Amanda is 28 years old and lives in Long Town with her husband and two children, ages 8 and 15, who are in school. She has been running a shop where she sells cold water, soft drinks and other items. She says with her business, she is able to send her children to school. She started this business by selling for her friends. She is requesting a loan to buy more water by sack and soft drinks for her business. Her plans are to expand her business even more and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more water by sack and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu. She is a 41-year-old from Waterloo, eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 12 years and 19 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2005, Kadiatu established her local food business within the Waterloo community. She began her business because she did not go to school and was forced into early marriage, so she decided to empower herself with business. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the price inflation of goods.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more local food like ground nuts, gari [cassava flakes] and beans. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Kadiatu plans to become a supplier of local goods. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more local food like ground nuts, gari [cassava flakes] and beans.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata. She is a 43-year-old from Waterloo, eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children. She has two additional dependents at home. In 2003, Fatmata established a restaurant business within the Waterloo community. She began this business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income to support her children. She works at the business from 10:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m., six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the price inflation of goods.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, beer, bagged rice and cooking seasonings. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her restaurant to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, beer, bagged rice and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Matrisah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Matrisah from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 3 years and 13 years old. Two of her children are attending school. She started her business because she dropped out of school at an early age and she doesn’t want to be idle.  

Matrisah runs a provision shop; she sells milk, sugar, ovaltine, mayonnaise, and drinks. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business seven day per week, twelve hours per day.  Matrisah says that the main challenge to her business is transporting goods from the city to her business place, which is very difficult.

Matrisah has requested a loan in order to purchase food items including milk, sugar, ovaltine, mayonnaise, and drinks for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to buy a plot of land and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food items including milk, sugar, ovaltine, mayonnaise, and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Marleni

texts.es: Rosa de 32 años de edad vive junto a su familia, su esposo y sus tres pequeños hijos de 2, 3 y 13 años. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre ha velado por el interés de su familia, desde hace ya 3 años vive en casa humilde pero propia y está muy contenta porque poco a poco ha ido mejorando. Rosa trabaja vendiendo conserva de coco, queso y chicharrón. Rosa desea con muchas ansias cambiar el techo de su hogar, ya que se aproximan lluvias y no está con las condiciones necesarias la teja que tiene su techo está muy deteriorada; es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la  construcción de dicho techo sustituyendo la teja por lamina galvanizada y clavos para techo entre otros. Espera realizar lo antes posible esta reparación así estarán más tranquilos sus pequeños hijos dentro de su casa.
texts.en:
32-year-old Rosa lives with her family, her husband and their three young children ages 2, 3 and 13. She is a very hardworking woman who always looks after the interests of her family. For the past three years they have been living in a humble home, but she is very happy as they have slowly been improving it. Rosa has a business selling coconut preserves, cheese, and pork products.
