Rosa is very anxious to repair the roof of her home. The tiles are badly damaged and the roof is not in a good condition to withstand the approaching rains. This is why she has approached FUSAI to request a loan, which will be used to repair the roof and replace the tiles with galvanized metal sheets and roofing nails, among others. She hopes to be able to make these repairs as soon as possible, so that her children will be more comfortable at home.

loans.use: Replacing the tiled roof with galvanized metal sheets and roofing nails, among others.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto de cuarenta y dos  años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida de 39 años, su hijo de 1 año y una hija de 16 años en casa propia, él es mecánico automotriz y además para complementar gastos vende granos básicos, maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de experiencia en su labor y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar; Carlos es un hombre entregado a su trabajo, desea que los miembros de su familia vivan en mejores condiciones, en un hogar seguro y un poco más amplio, quiere continuar la construcción de un cuarto que dejó incompleto necesita terminar las paredes, poner ventanas, techo, puerta y piso hasta donde alcance, quiere realizarlo lo más pronto posible pero no posee de capital suficiente que abarque los costos de los materiales, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, arena, ladrillo para piso, ventanas, lamina, polines, entre otros. Carlos tiene buenas referencias de pago, se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y está muy agradecido con la ayuda.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is a 42-year old man who lives with his life partner (39 years old), his 1 year-old son and his 16-year old daughter. He works as an automotive mechanic and also sells basic grains, such as corn and beans, to generate additional income. He has several years of experience, which has allowed him to bring home the bacon every day. 

Carlos is a hard-working man and wants his family to have the best possible quality of life in a safe house. He wants to finish an extra room that is incomplete and needs walls, windows, ceiling, floor and a door. However, he does not have enough capital to invest, which is why he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy cement, sand, bricks for the floor, windows, layers and steel bars, among others. Carlos has good payment references, has committed to settle his debt and is very grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks for the floor, windows, layers and steel bars.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 33-year-old Mariama from Waterloo, in the Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 7 years and 14 years. Her children are going to school. She attended school up to class six and because of the death of her mother she decided to start a business to support her younger sister and brother.   

Mariama runs a general merchandise store. She sells milk, sugar, cigarettes, pure water and drinks. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business seven days, twelve hours per day.  Mariama says that the main challenge to her business is that transporting her goods from the city to her business place is very difficult.

Mariama has requested a loan in order to purchase items including milk, sugar, cigarettes, pure water and drinks for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to buy a plot of land and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to open a big provision shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase items such as milk, sugar, cigarettes, pure water and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Mary is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling gari (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava). She usually sells her gari in Apowa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling gari for five years. Mary is married and has four children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Mary wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty gari. In the long term, Mary plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava to increase her current inventory.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is a small-scale stationery and other office supplies vendor in Apowa (near Cape Coast.) She has had some form of formal education as she is a senior high graduate with vocational training. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Christina has been working as a stationery and other office supplies for close to eight years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of stationery and other office supplies, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a stationery and other office supplies stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of stationery and other office supplies.

loans.name: Abdelhamid

texts.en:
Abdelhamid is a 24-year-old single man from Rafah city. He owns a small mobile phone shop where he sell mobiles and provides maintenance service for his customers. He is a well-known man in his city and has loyal customers. A few years ago, his store was a simple one, but now, he works hard to grow and improve his income.

Abdelhamid requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more mobile phones to resell in his store. This will improve his business and also his income.

Abdelhamid appears in the photo while he was in his store.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones to resell in his store.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in the photo in front of their supermarket.

Nawal is a 50-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and son in a small house in the city. Her son is still a student in the university. Nawal and her husband own a small supermarket in a crowded area in Rafah. It is very profitable but because of high family expenses, they can't improve their business. 

Nawal took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more products that customers frequently order. This will improve the supermarket's conditions and also increase their income.

loans.use: to buy more products that customers frequently order in her supermarket.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 34-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for three young children, two sons and one daughter. Ahmad is an employee in the public sector. He gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs.

Ahmad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family home. By applying this loan, Ahmad can provide pure water for his kids and prevent them from pollution and disease.

Ahmad appears in the photo at home.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family home.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 33-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of seven young children, four sons and three daughters. Mohammad is an employee in the public sector. He gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs. He also works repairing electrical machines and home appliances.

Mohammad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family home. By applying this loan, Mohammad can provide pure water for his kids and prevent them from pollution and disease. 

Mohammad appears in the photo at the home appliance store.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family home.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en: Sokunthea is 26 years old. She is married and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a tailoring shop for more than two years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband sells palm thatches. He earns about $1 each day. Her child is employed in a garment factory and earns about $4 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sokunthea is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more palm thatches to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a bigger house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm thatches to resell.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 34 years old from Ozamiz City. He is married with one child. He earns a living through motorcycle transport. He earns Php 14,000 a month. 

He has seek a loan from PMPC to purchase another motorcycle for transport. In the future, he wants to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy an additional motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es un profesional de 34 años, está casado con Marleni y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa alquilada. Felix tiene una farmacia y lleva mas de 5 años con su negocio, donde ofrece a sus clientes una diversa variedad de medicamentos de marca con la intención de aportar por el bienestar y la salud de su localidad. Asimismo también tiene a la venta  diversa variedad de artículos para bebes, entre otros.
Tiene la facilidad de contar con un local amplio y adecuado para su negocio ya que el propietario es un familiar suyo. Cuenta siempre con el apoyo de su esposa quien también tiene conocimientos en el rubro logrando así desempeñar su negocio de manera familiar. Desea contar con capital de trabajo que le permita adquirir un nuevo lote de medicinas en general tanto como de marca como genéricos, así como la compra de insumos que complementen los servicios generales que ofrece. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con  2,000 nuevos soles para realizar la compra de de medicamentos al por mayor de marca y genéricos y así abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Felix, 34, is a professional and married to Marleni with whom he has two children. They live together in a rented house. For the past five years, Felix has had a pharmacy business which offers clients a diverse range of brand name medicines, with the intent to improve welfare and health in his neighborhood. He also sells a variety of baby products, among other items.

Felix has the advantage of having a large premises for his business, as the owner is a relative of his. He can always count on the support of his wife, who is able to assist as she also has expertise in the industry and is familiar with the business. Felix requires working capital so that he can purchase a new batch of branded and generic medicines, as well as other items to supplement the general services he offers.

This is his second loan with Kiva, and he is grateful for the financial support he has received to help him progress. He agrees to comply with the repayment schedule. This time, Felix has requested a loan of 2,000 soles to invest in branded and generic wholesale medicines to stock his business.

loans.use: to purchase medicines

loans.name: Apiza

texts.ru: Апиза 57 лет,разведена, одна воспитывает 2 детей. У Апизы - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Апиза занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 24 года назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Апизы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 30 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,5 ГА, на которой она ежегодно выращивает: кукурузу, подсолнечник, картофель. Дополнительным доходом являются заработки старшего сына, который находится в России. Он ежемесячно высылает свою зарплату матери для поддержания семьи. Ежемесячный доход Апизы составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Апиза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Апиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Apiza is 57 years old, divorced and is raising two children. Apiza has higher education. She does animal husbandry as a main source of income for her family which she started 24 years ago with the purchase of cattle for an amount of 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work Apiza now has four milk cows, thirty sheep and also a plot of land in the size of 1.5 hectares where he annually grows corn, sunflower and potatoes. The additional source of income comes from her oldest son who is working in Russia. He sends his salary to his mother monthly to support the family. Apiza's monthly income is 10,000 KGS. With the purpose to further grow her business Apiza has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to buy cows for feeding and resale. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the headcount of livestock and plans to save money to repair the house.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 33 years old and is married with two children. She supports her family through her simple general store business situated in front of their home. She has been in this business for five years. Marites is requesting to take a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to buy grocery items such as beverages, condiments, and assorted breads to sell. She hopes that she can lift up her children out of poverty and she also hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as beverages, condiments, and assorted breads to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is known as a responsible mother of one child. She is 24 and has this strong determination in lifting up her family from poor living with her fruits and vegetables business. She is married to Johnny, a farmer in their village of Mabbayad. She commonly sells bananas in their village, for two years and six months to be exact. As of now, she is requesting a loan to buy more bananas to resell. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices in making the business grow, she'll have a viable and profitable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 37 years old and lives in Bontod, Larena, Siquijor. She is married with four children who are school-aged. To earn a living, Analyn has engaged in video-k activity. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Analyn has requested a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to be used in purchasing additional video-k equipment such as microphones, chairs and tables. Analyn is a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Analyn hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: to purchase additional video-k equipment such as microphones, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio de veintitrés años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia, el trabaja de albañil a tiempo completo y además pinta algunas casas donde lo contratan y así complementa los gastos del hogar, desde hace algún tiempo necesita invertir en la construcción de un nuevo cuarto para el bebe que esperan pues desean darle la mayor comodidad y seguridad; quiere invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital que logre completar el gasto pues debido a su baja condición económica es muy difícil, por eso se decidió solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar, el cemento, ladrillos, arena, entre otros. Juan Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago de parte de sus conocidos, se compromete a cancelar la deuda en el tiempo establecido, está muy contento y agradece la ayuda.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio, 23, lives together with his life partner in a house of their own. He works full-time as a mason. He also gets hired to paint houses, which helps him complement what is left to cover the home expenses.

For some time now, he has had the need to invest in the construction of a new room for the baby they are expecting. They want to give her/him a comfortable and safe place to live in. He does not have enough money to do so and his financial situation is tough. This is why he decided to request a loan at FUSAI to buy cement, bricks and sand, among other materials. Juan Antonio’s acquaintances give good references of his payment record. He promises to pay the loan according to plan. He feels very happy and appreciates the help he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and sand to build a room for his child.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su madre en casa propia desde hace once años. El se dedica a la venta de especies, curtido, y dulces por mayor, tiene varios años con el negocio y aunque no es muy regular le ayuda a ganarse el sustento de cada día; es un hombre decidido, trabajador y muy responsable siempre está a la expectativa de oportunidades que le permitan salir adelante, el vive en una zona rural muy humilde y desde hace algún tiempo desea terminar de construir un cuarto que dejó incompleto necesita un techo, piso y puerta, tiene toda la disposición de iniciar de nuevo el trabajo pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente debido a su baja condición económica por eso se decidió a solicitarle a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar lamina galvanizada, ladrillo de piso, una puerta entre otros. Víctor Manuel  está muy contento y agradeció con la ayuda y espera responder bien con cada pago.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel, 42, has been living together with his life partner and his mother in a house of their own for eleven years. He sells spices, curtido [a salad made out of cabbage] and candies in bulk. He has been doing this for a couple of years and even if the business has its ups and downs, he makes a living out of it.

He is a determined, hardworking and responsible man, always looking for opportunities to get ahead. He lives in a humble rural area and has been thinking for some time to finish building a room he left unfinished; it needs a roof, floor and a door.

He is eager to start again but does not have the money, since his financial situation is tough. This is why he decided to request a loan at FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, floor tiles and a door, among other things. Víctor Manuel feels very happy and appreciates the help he is receiving. He hopes to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, floor tiles and a door to finish a room.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is 48 years old and lives in Poblacion, San Juan, Siquijor. She is married with adult aged-children. To earn a living, Expedita has engaged in vegetable vending activity. She earns about PHP 25,000 each month doing this type of work. Expedita has requested a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to be used in purchasing additional vegetables such as cabbages, carrots, string beans etc.

Expedita is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables such as cabbages, carrots, string beans etc.

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en:
Chhen is 50 years old. She is married and has four children. She is a farmer and has enough experience to manage this business since it is the major source of her income. As with other villagers, she chooses to grow rice crops because people use them every day, which results in a high demand for her products. She has been in this occupation for nearly 33 years and earns a net profit of $5 per day.

Chhen has never been with other state banks or MFIs before; this will be her first loan through Kiva and its partner, HKL. She is requesting a loan to build a latrine, and HKL has provided her with a special interest rate to encourage her to build a healthy family by releasing less pollutants. She appreciates all the help that Kiva lenders give her through HKL.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Rosa Mabel

texts.es: Rosa Mabel de treinta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos uno de 12 y de 10 y uno de 8 años, habitan casa propia desde hace 10 años. Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad y su esposo le ayuda a complementar gastos con su taller de estructura metálica, con el tiempo han aprendido a ganarse el sustento diario; Rosa es una mujer activa, humilde y por supuesto emprendedora, a pesar de su baja condición económica siempre trabaja duro buscando que su familia tenga lo que necesita en el hogar, su vivienda requiere de la construcción de un sanitario,   pues en el cantón solo hay fosas y son menos seguras para sus hijos, quiere empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible, pero no posee de capital por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillo, lamina, entre otros. Rosa Mabel está feliz con la ayuda, y se compromete a cancelarla.
texts.en:
Rosa Mabel, 36, lives with her common-law husband and their three children, ages 12, 10 and 8.  They have lived in their own house for ten years.  She runs a store where she sells essential items and her husband helps cover expenses with his metal structure workshop.  With time they have been able to earn a daily living.

Rosa is a very active, modest entrepreneur who, despite her low economic situation, has always worked hard to obtain what the family needs at home.  Her house is in need of a bathroom because in the local area there are only outhouses, which are less safe for her children.  She wants to start work as soon as possible but does not have the money to do so.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, bricks, metal sheeting, etc.

Rosa Mabel is grateful for the support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy cement, bricks, metal sheeting.

loans.name: Filder

texts.es:
Filder tiene  33 años, esta casado con Delaida y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Filder se dedica a la venta de calzados en una feria dominical de su distrito donde al igual que otros comerciantes de prendas para vestir reciben a un sin numero de clientes quienes son personas del campo que llegan a la ciudad con el objetivo de realizar sus compras semanales. Se inició hace mas de 8 años motivado por su esposa ya que tenía la responsabilidad de velar por el bienestar de su familia. Fue así que uso dinero que había ahorrado hasta entonces trabajando en diversos oficios y compró su primer lote de calzados que vendió de manera ambulante. Tiempo después decidió incursionar como vendedor en la feria dominical de su distrito promovido por las autoridades de su localidad , logrando así consolidar su negocio en beneficio de su economía.
Podemos hallar en su puesto diversos zapatos y zapatillas para damas y caballeros, así como zapatitos para bebes y escolares. Se siente muy contento con su trabajo ya que le permite tener muy buenos ingresos económicos. Con el tiempo desea ampliar su negocio de calzados y convertirse en un proveedor mayorista.
Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 nuevo soles para comprar mercadería tales como calzados para damas y niños; así como zapatillas para los agricultores.
texts.en:
Filder, 33, is married to Delaida and they have two children who live with them in their own home.  Filder sells shoes at the Sunday market in his district where other merchants sell clothing.  Many customers, including farmers, visit the city to make their weekly purchases.  Filder started his business eight years ago, encouraged by his wife, in order to take care of the family.  He used the money he had saved from working in different jobs to buy his first batch of shoes which he sold as a street vendor.  Later on he decided to sell his goods at the Sunday fair in his district which is organized by the local authorities.  He was able to consolidate his business which has helped his economy.

At his stall we can find different kinds of men's and women's shoes and slippers as well as baby and school children's shoes.  He is very happy with his work because he earns a good income.  Over time he wants to expand his business and become a wholesale supplier.

This is his second Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support and committed to paying back the loan on time.  This time he has requested 3,000 PEN to buy merchandise such as women's and children's shoes, and footwear for farmers.

loans.use: To buy women's and children's shoes, and farmer footwear.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is single and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.

Josephine has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle.

Josephine has been in this business for one year now, and she also earns additional income from pig-fattening.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle.

loans.name: Sonia Natali

texts.es: Sonia Natali de veintiséis años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos pequeños uno de 2 años y el otro de 4 años en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, además  su esposo le ayuda a complementar los gastos del hogar, es agricultor siembra maíz y pipián, son una familia muy humilde y con pocos recursos económicos pero con su trabajo han logrado el sustento de cada día. Sonia es una mujer dinámica, responsable y muy audaz siempre está buscando oportunidades para salir adelante, su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en una zona rural y en esta época de lluvia necesita realizar reparaciones pues el techo está podrido y le causa inseguridad a los que la habitan, quiere empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible, pero no posee de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar lamina galvanizada. Sonia Natali está muy agradecida y espera poder cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Sonia Natali, 26, lives with her common-law husband and their two small children, ages two and four, in their own house.  She sells new clothing and her husband, who is a farmer who grows corn and chili peppers, helps cover the household expenses.  They are a modest family with scarce economic resources, but with their work they are able to earn a daily living.  

Sonia is a dynamic, responsible, innovative woman who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead.  Her home is located in a rural area and because of the current rainy season she must repair the roof which has rotted out, making the home unsafe to live in.  She wants to start the work as soon as possible but does not have the money to do so.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheeting.  Sonia Natali is very grateful and hopes to be able to pay back the loan.

loans.use: To buy galvanized metal sheeting to fix her roof.

loans.name: Silvia Magdalena

texts.es: Silvia Magdalena de sesenta años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia desde hace cuarenta años, ella es dueña de dos moto taxis, con las que trabaja 26 días al mes  además su esposo hace viajes para vender cal y con eso logran complementar gastos del hogar, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, siempre está buscando alternativas que le den la oportunidad de salir adelante, desde hace algún tiempo necesita construir una pared de un cuarto que dejó incompleto y además quiere repellar las otras tres paredes para poder pintarlo, desea poder realizar este trabajo lo más rápido que se pueda, pues para ella es algo indispensable, pero no cuenta con la solvencia económica suficiente para costear los gastos, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar los materiales cemento, grava, arena, etc. Silvia Magdalena se compromete a pagar toda la deuda con ayuda de su esposo ya que están muy agradecidos con la ayuda.
texts.en: Silvia Magdalena is sixty years old. She has lived with her life's companion in her own home for forty years. She is the owner of two motorcycle taxis which she works 26 days a month. In addition, her husband travels to sell lime, and with that they are able to pay the household expenses. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She is always seeking alternatives that will give her the opportunity to get ahead. For some time, she has needed to build a wall of a room that wasn't finished. She also wants to plaster the other three walls in order to paint the room. She wants to be able to do this work as soon as possible because for her it is really necessary, but she doesn't have enough financial solvency to pay for the expenses. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan that will allow her to buy materials such as cement, gravel, sand, etc. Silvia Magdalena is committed to paying off her whole debt with her husband's help, because they are very grateful for the help.

loans.use: construction of a wall, and buying cement, gravel and sand.

loans.name: Mercel

texts.en:
Mercel is 32 years old and married with one child.

Mercel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Mercel has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fishing and gasoline retailing.

Mercel aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rogelio Efigenio

texts.es: Rogelio de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus  cinco hijos en casa propia desde hace tres años. El es agricultor siembra maíz y pipián comercia en diferentes lugares de la zona, es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su trabajo y a su familia. Rogelio siempre ha buscado en la medida de sus posibilidades darles lo que necesitan por eso para tener un poco de mas espacio en el hogar decidió hacer un corredor  al frente de la casa además quiere construir una pared ya que se le mete el agua cada vez que llueve, desea empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible pero debido a su condición económica no posee de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar, ladrillo, piso,  cemento, arena, entre otros. Rogelio está muy contento con la ayuda y se siente comprometido a cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Rogelio, 49, lives with his common-law wife and their five children in their own home where they have been for three years.  He is a farmer who grows corn and chili peppers which he sells in different places in the area.  He is an entrepreneur who is dedicated to his work and family.  Rogelio is always looking for ways to give his family what they need.  He wants to add more space at home and has decided to build a hall along the front of the house as well as as a wall to keep out the water that gets in when it rains.  

He wants to start the work as soon as possible but does not have the money to do so.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand and other materials.  

Rogelio is very grateful for the support and committed to paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, and sand to build a wall.

loans.name: Emilia Estefany

texts.es: Emilia Estefany de veinte años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su madre en casa propia desde hace algún tiempo. Ella es una joven emprendedora, responsable y muy humilde, necesita poner en su vivienda dos puertas de hierro para mayor seguridad de los miembros del hogar, ya conoce un taller donde le darán buenos precios por hacerle las puertas y espera poder realizar lo más pronto posible pero no posee de capital suficiente que pueda costear los gastos por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar las puertas de hierro. Emilia Estefany está muy contenta con la ayuda y asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda.
texts.en: Emilia Estefany is twenty years old. She has lived with her life's companion and her mother in her own home for some time. She is an enterprising, responsible and very humble young woman. She needs to put two wrought iron doors on her home for more security for the household members. She already knows of a workshop that will give her good prices for making the doors. She hopes to be able to do it as soon as possible but she doesn't have enough capital to pay the expenses. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan that will allow her to buy the wrought iron doors. Emilia Estefany is very happy with the help and sure she can pay off the debt.

loans.use: to buy and install wrought iron doors.

loans.name: Mauricio Alejandro

texts.es: Mauricio Alejandro de cincuenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia. Él es albañil y además vende verduras, su esposa le ayuda con el negocio,  son muy unidos, entre los dos han logrado salir adelante, Mauricio es un hombre entregado a su labor, muy responsable y sobre todo humilde, le gusta aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presentan, ahora quiere realizar algunas reparaciones en su vivienda las puertas están muy deterioradas y se ha vuelto inseguro para la familia, necesita comprar dos puertas nuevas de hierro pero no posee de capital que lo respalde, se decidió solicitarle a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar las puertas, ya que el solo no puede cubrir los gastos. Mauricio Antonio está muy contento y agradecido con la ayuda y asegura que podrá saldar toda la deuda.
texts.en: Mauricio Alejandro is fifty years old. He lives with his life's companion in his own house. He is a bricklayer and also sells vegetables. His wife helps him with the business. They are very united and between the two of them they are able to get ahead. Mauricio is a man who is dedicated to his work, very responsible and above all humble. He likes to take advantage of all of the opportunities that come his way. Now he wants to make some repairs on his house. The doors are very deteriorated and it has become unsafe for the family. He needs to buy two new wrought iron doors but he doesn't have capital to back him up. He decided to ask FUSAI for a loan that will allow him to buy the doors, since he can't cover the expenses himself. Mauricio Antonio is very happy and grateful with the help and sure he can pay off the debt.

loans.use: to buy and install two wrought iron gates.

loans.name: Alianza Emprendedora 2 Group

texts.es:
Efraín, tiene 60 años de edad, es casado tiene 4 hijos y vive con su esposa y uno de sus  hijos en el municipio de Yoro. Toda su vida ha sido agricultor dedicado al  cultivo de maíz y frijoles. La producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. El ha solicitado ya 16 ciclos de préstamos en ODEF con el actual, el cual es por 7,000 lempiras y es en forma grupal. Con este préstamo comprar fertilizantes y semillas para siembra de maíz y frijoles. Su plan es llegar a tener su propio capital para seguir trabajando y ayudar a sus hijos con la educación.
El grupo se llama Alianza Emprendedora 2, esta formado por 8 miembros que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. El préstamo grupal es por 59,000 lempiras y lo utilizaran para comprar fertilizantes y semillas para sembrar maíz y frijoles para la venta. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Efraín de camisa celeste manga larga, el de camisa Beige es José Ernesto, Saúl de camisa verde,  Ananías esta a la derecha de camisa rayada manga larga, en frente de camiseta negra es José Lucindo, Santiago de camisa celeste manga corta, José Estanislao tiene camisa cuadriculada y don Enrique de camisa manga corta rayada y pantalón blanco.
texts.en:
Efraín, 60, is married and has four children.  He lives with his wife and one of their children in the town of Yoro.  All of his life he has been a farmer, growing corn and beans.  He sells his produce at the local market in the area.  This will be his 16th loan through ODEF and with the communal bank; and it is for the amount of 7,000 HNL.  He will use the loan to buy seeds to plant corn and beans. His plan is to earn enough of his own money to continue working and help his children finish their education.

The communal bank "Alianza Emprendedora 2" is comprised of eight members who live in the same community and are farmers.  The group loan for 59,000 HNL will be used to buy fertilizers and seeds to plant corn and beans to sell.  In the photograph we see in the back row, from left to right:  Efraín in a light blue, long-sleeved shirt, José Ernesto in a beige shirt and Saúl in a green shirt.  To the right in a long-sleeved, striped shirt is Ananías.  In the front row from the left in a black shirt is José Lucindo, then Santiago in a short-sleeved light blue shirt, José Estanislado is wearing a plaid shirt and Enrique is wearing a short-sleeved striped shirt and white pants.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Frine

texts.es:
Frine tiene 34 años  , esta casada con Marcelino y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.Frine se dedica a la agricultura en su terreno de 2 hectáreas. Se inició hace 7 años y desde entonces trata de obtener una buena calidad de sus cosechas con el apoyo de su esposo y de algunos trabajadores del lugar a quienes contrata para realizar tareas complicadas como el retiro de maleza y cosecha de las mazorcas.
En ocasiones cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos para tareas menores quienes se sienten muy orgullosos de sus padres. Para obtener un mejor resultado de sus cosechas fertiliza sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico los cuales son muy buenos para el cacao, además de llevar una producción natural evitando el uso de abonos artificiales. Además de cosechar cacao, también posee en un área considerable de cafe, ya que obtiene buenas ganancias adicionales. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Frine is 34 years old. She is married to Marcelino and they have 2 children who live in the home they own. Frine works as a farmer on her two hectare plot of land. She started 7 years ago and since then has tried to obtain good quality harvests with the help of her husband and some workers from the area she hires to do the complicated work like weeding and harvesting the pods.

At times, she has the help of  her three children for minor tasks. They are proud of their parents. To obtain a better result for her harvests, she fertilizes her cropland with organic fertilizer which is very good for the cacao. It also allows for natural growth and avoids artificial fertilizers. In addition to growing cacao, she also has a considerable area for coffee, which obtains good additional income. This is her third loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving to get head. She is also committed to making her payments on time. At this time, she wants 2,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes de 42 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos (18, 12 y 3 años de edad). Su forma de ganarse la vida es que lava ropa ajeno entre semana va a casas a lavar y le pagan por realizar esta labor, desea con tanta urgencia poder cambiar el techo de su hogar ya que la lámina existente está muy deteriorada es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para a comprar lamina galvanizada, pines para reparar el techo de su humilde vivienda. Confía en Dios que pronto podrá realizar este sueño.
texts.en: María Mercedes is 42 and lives with her partner and their three children, aged 3, 12 and 18. She earns money during the week by washing clothes. She goes to people's houses and they pay her to wash their clothes. She desperately needs a new roof for her house as the current sheeting is damaged. She is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanised sheets and nails to repair the roof of her humble home. She trusts that God will help her realise her dream.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her home by buying galvanised sheets and nails.

loans.name: Sigaran Indah Group

texts.en:
Having had good results in their last period, the Sigaran Indah group decided to continue its loans. With a same loan amount and number of members, the loans are used to improve their pig businesses.

Ni Made wants to improve her business. With the new loan she will purchase 3 piglets and feed. She still has piglets and a sow from the previous loan. The piglets will sell after she keeps them for 2 months. The business helped her to renovate her house, and now she has a plan to save all the profit and use it for business capital later. Ni Made hopes that the Loan Officer of MUK will still train and help her to run her pig business.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and feed.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old. She is married to Julian. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with four children. To raise her family well, Alma is busy managing their hog-raising business. She has been in this business for three years and usually earns about PHP2,500 net income per grown up pig when sold. 

Alma wants to lift her family from poor living. That's why she works hard with the business. At this moment, she wants to have more hogs to raise. To make this possible, she is requesting a loan to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them. Alma hopes that she will have the loan on hand to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is married with 4 children. She is 51 years of age and lives in Upper Bag-ong Tudela Josefina, Zamboanga Del Sur. She sells dry goods, soft drinks, office supplies, bond papers, etc. to earn a living and has had this type of work for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately 30,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase new dry goods, office supplies, bond papers, soft drinks, etc. Merlinda has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost 3 years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions and earn more for the future.

loans.use: to purchase new dry goods, office supplies, soft drinks, bond paper, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 37 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from fishing. Leonila aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items like cold drinks, spices, toothpaste, soap and more to sell.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen, aged 32, is married to a driver and they are blessed with two children. She has been managing a hog raising business for almost 5 years, and she has a net income of about Php 2,000 per hog. Due to lack of capital she's asking for a loan amounting to Php 13,000 to purchase hog feeds for her hogs. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds for her hogs.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon, 34 years old, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 10 years. In this business she's earning a net income of about Php 500 a day. 

She decided to request a loan due to insufficient funds and she's requesting an amount of Php 10,000 to purchase noodles, canned goods, biscuits, sugar, coffee and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her retail store will improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase noodles, canned goods, biscuits, sugar, coffee, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for 40,000 PHP to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nancy dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Boeun

texts.en:
Boeun is from a village of the Moung Ruessei district, Battambang. She is 44 years old and lives with her family of eight members. Three of the children are still attending school. She is a farmer who works hard on a small piece of land, but her income is still not stable and hardly enough to feed her family. To financially support this family, two of her children decided to work in Thailand in return for a fee and send remittances home to their parents each month.

Boeun has requested a loan amounting to 700 US dollars to pay for construction supplies she will use to build a latrine and pay for labor costs. This will increase the value of her family and promote their health because currently there is no bathroom in the house. More importantly, the family will release fewer pollutants and keep the environment surrounding her house clean. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan HKL has provided her a special interest rate other than its general loan.

loans.use: to pay for construction supplies she will use to build a latrine and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 64-year-old married woman. She has 7 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 40 years. She describes herself as credible. She operates a retail store where she sells beans, sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a profitable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the inflation of prices which reduces the profits. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy flour, sugar and maize to sell. Her business goal is to become a leading trader in the area within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-reliant. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and maize to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, a 59-year-old married mother of eight children ranging in age from 6 years to 40 years, describes herself as honest. For 10 years now she has operated a cereals store where she sells maize and beans. Located in an area conducive to the business, her primary customers are local residents. Her biggest challenge is insufficient capital to expand her enterprise. 


Margaret will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy maize to resell.  This is her second loan with SMEP DTM, her previous one for KES 20,000 fully repaid. Hoping to be self-reliant in the future, Margaret's goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali, a 24 year old single woman with a small child , describes herself as talkative. A water vendor for three years now, her business is located in a commercial area, and her primary customers are both men and women. She describes her biggest challenges as insufficient business funds and frequent water shortages. 


Mwikali will use this KES 15,000 loan to buy a cart for transporting water to her clients. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children up to the graduate level. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: Buy a cart for transporting water to her clients.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a married woman with four children, describes herself as honest. She operates a hotel where she sells food, a business she has been involved in for two years. Located in a busy area, her primary customers come from all walks of life. Her biggest challenge is insufficient business funds. 


Agnes will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more chairs and tables for use in the hotel. She hopes to have a financially stable business in the future, as she plans to have a big hotel within five years. This is Agnes' first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more chairs and tables for use in the hotel

loans.name: Petrona Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima Petrona de 52 años de edad, soltero con hijos mayores de edad. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de  occidente del país. Fátima es una mujer trabajadora, responsable  de buenas costumbres con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de su tiempo libre para pasar en compañia de su familia.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de carne en su casa de habitación, Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de carne , para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Fátima Petrona agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Fátima Petrona is fifty-two years old and is single with older children.  She is a native of León, a city located in the western part of the country.  Fátima is a very hardworking and responsible woman, and she has a lot of drive to make herself better.  In her free moments, she likes to enjoy time in the company of her family.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to move ahead, she now sells meat from her home.  She makes a living offering her products twelve hours each day.  She will use the loan to invest in working capital and to supply her business so that in the near future, she can make a better income.  

Fátima Petrona is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors have offered to people with scarce resources from poor countries, like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to supply her business selling meat.

loans.name: Ukuri Group

texts.fr:
Césarie  fait partie du groupe  Ukuri  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 23 ans et est mariée à  Egide,  un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant.
Sa famille a élève 3 enfants membre de la famille élargie.

Elle  fait le commerce des fruits et légumes  depuis  4 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  la quantité des fruits et légumes à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Césarie is a member of the Ukuri group and lives in Gitega. She is 23 years old and married to Egide, a shopkeeper. They have one child together. Césarie's family is raising 3 children as part of their extended family. She has been in the business of fruits and vegetables for the last 4 years. She is on her second loan with Turame. With the loan from Kiva that she obtains, she will increase the quantity of fruits and vegetables to resell, in order to earn more money.

loans.use: increase the quantity of fruits and vegetables to resell in order to earn more

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Dorica, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children who are still going to school. She has been running two businesses: dagaa (fried small fish) and a grocery.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Dorica's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more stock of fried dagaa (very small fish) and to restock the out-of-stock drinks in the grocery inventory. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to buy a plot. She really appreciates the loan, which used to be weekly but now it has gone to bi-weekly.  She is also happy that the percent of interest rate has gone down. She is really doing great.  She will use this loan to  buy chairs and tables for the grocery and more drinks. She dreams of opening a supermarket.

Dorica will share this loan with her loan group "Karibu View," which has eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for the grocery, and more drinks.

loans.name: Minazini Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her mid 40s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has been having several businesses, selling clothes, cooking oil and traditional chicken since 2001. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Amina's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil and bought more chicken and chicks. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, bought a mattress and covered household expenses. She will use this loan buy more chicks for broilers. She dreams of building her own house.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, "Minazini," with five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for broilers.

loans.name: Felistah

texts.en:
Felistah is a 28-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be aggressive. She operates a hotel where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business, and her primary customers are college students. She describes her biggest business challenge to be government policies. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to add stock of cooking oil, wheat and maize flour and other ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to be stable and successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of cooking oil, wheat and maize flour and other ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Lesli

texts.es:
Doña Lesli es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposo e hijos en un Barrio al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas y vende desde su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante, desde hace más de 4 años.
Doña Lesli el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de manteca, frijoles, queso, plátanos, carnes, verduras, etc. que son la materia prima para seguir realizando su negocio. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor a sus clientes.
Doña Lesli espera cubrir las necesidades que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga creciendo y se convierta en una tienda de golosinas donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.
Doña Lesli su sueño es tener un local más grande y sea muy reconocido de la zona para elevar sus ingresos y que sus hijos se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la sociedad.


Choluteca, Honduras –Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Doña Lesli is a responsible, honest, and hardworking person who lives with her husband and children in a barrio in southern Honduras. She has for over four years sold food both in her home and in the street. 

Doña Lesli is applying for a loan so that she can purchase butter, beans, cheese, bananas, meat, vegetables, and other goods that are the essential supplies she needs to continue operating her business. She hopes that the loan will  lead to better customer service and increased sales as she'll have more foods to offer. Doña Lesli hopes that an expanded menu will lead to increased sales will help her meet her expenses and improve her family's quality of life a little bit. She hopes that her business will continue to grow in the next few years and that she can open a food shop in her home, offering better service to her customers. Doña Lesli's ambition is to have a bigger store and gain a reputation throughout the area in order to boost her income and allow her her children to become upstanding people with greater opportunities in their society.   

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to purchase butter, beans, cheese, bananas, meat, vegetables, and other goods for her business.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es: Victorino es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. De 50 años de edad, casado y padre de 4 hijos. Es de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, trigo y cuido de ganado, actividad que realiza desde hace 30 años.  Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante.  Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso la crianza y venta de cerdos. Su expectativa es realizar  su siembra con éxito, ya que podrá vender un producto de calidad para sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como: Fertilizantes, pesticida, urea, abono y el pago de mano de obra en esta cosecha realizada. El crédito será de mucha ayuda por lo que en estos momentos no tiene capital para invertir. Estima que al cancelar el préstamo, podrá solicitar otro con el fin de  crecer económicamente para el bienestar de su negocio y familia.
texts.en: Victorino is originally from the city of Boaca.  At 50 years old he is married and a father to four children.  He is a farmer, making a living growing corn and wheat, and raising cattle.  He has been doing this work for 30 years.  Thanks to his effort and dedication, he has been able to do well in life.  He also makes money from raising and selling pigs.  His expectation is to grow his crops successfully as he will then be able to sell his customers good quality products.  Victorino is applying for this loan in order to buy supplies such as fertilisers, pesticides, urea, manure, and to pay for labourers.  The loan will be of great help as Victorino does not currently have any capital to invest in his business.  Victorino reckons that, once this loan is paid off, he will be able to apply for another one in order to improve his business's and his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilisers, pesticides, urea, manure, and to pay for labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tyres for cars and motorbikes.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 29-year-old, married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be committed. 

He is a mechanic and he does motor vehicle repairs. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area fit for the business and his primary customers are vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of proper machines to improve service delivery. 

William will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy machines to help in repairing motor vehicles. His business goal is to be stable within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy machines to help in repairing vehicles.

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a married woman with three children, two in school and one who is still underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es: José, tiene 55 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de La Masica, Atlántida. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura y hace 3 años decidió establecer un negocio de brindar servicio con un molino de moler granos como ser maíz, arroz, coco, pinol, etc. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y atiende todo el día. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 4000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar para la compra de medicinas naturales como manzanilla, anís, ajo, quina, etc. y farmacéuticos como pastillas para la venta de la misma con el propósito de poder tener otra fuente de ingresos además del molino. Su plan es que el negocio tanto del molino como de la venta de medicinas crezca y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old, single, has two children and lives in the municipality of La Masica, Atlántida. He used to be a farmer but three years ago he decided to start a business offering the services of a grain mill to mill corn, rice, coconut, pinol (a roasted corn-based drink) etc. He has the business in his house and he looks after it every day.

José has requested a loan of 4,000 HNL which he will use to buy  natural medicines like camomile, anise, garlic, quinine, etc and  pharmaceuticals like pills for resale. The objective of this would be to give him another source of income other than the mill. His plan is that the mill and the sale of medicines grow and he can generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines like camomile, anise, garlic, quinine, etc and  pharmaceuticals like pills to resell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 39-year-old single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough money. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to own a wholesale boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a happy life.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno appreciates the previous loan she had from Kiva that enabled her to improve on her living standards through the profits she generated.
She is requesting a loan of KES 80,000 to purchase five goats for her business.She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase five goats for her business
